loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es soltera tiene 34 años, vive en una comunidad urbana en un distrito llamado la Matanza en la provincia de Morropon en le departamento de Piura al norte del Perú. Ella vive en casa propia en la habita con sus padre.

Mariela se a dedicado al comercio de abarrotes, pues desde hace 3 años ella ha instalado una bodega en su  domicilio. Allí ella ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad el ha podido mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

Mariela esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para que ella pueda adquirir mercadería para su negocio, como arroz azúcar, maíz, entre otros y de esta manera ampliar su negocio y percibir mejores ingresos para el beneficio de su familia. 

Mariela es una mujer responsable y de buen carácter  que desea salir adelante, con su trabajo y esfuerzo, ella posee muy buenas referencias personales y laborales dentro de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mariela is 34 years old and single.  She lives in an urban community, in a district called La Matanza, in Morropón province, in Piura department, in the north of Peru.  She lives in her own home together with her parents.

Mariela has been selling groceries for three years.  Her store is located in her home.  There she sells her neighbors a range of basic household products and groceries.  She currently has regular and loyal customers.  Thanks to her business, she has been able to support her family and get them ahead in life.

Mariela is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can buy more merchandise for her business such as rice, sugar, corn, etc.  In this way, she will expand her business and make better income for the benefit of her family.

Mariela is a responsible and good-natured woman who would like to get ahead in life through her hard work and effort.  She has very good personal and work references from her community.

loans.use: to acquire more merchandise for her business such as groceries and household products

loans.name: Maura Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Maura es socia del banco comunal Las Orquídeas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo adolescente.
Su primer préstamo le sirvió para iniciar otro negocio que no requería mucha inversión, actualmente de dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, carteras, zapatos y otros accesorios.
Lleva ya tres años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, su dinero lo invierte en la compra de mercadería, en Lima tiene una persona que se encarga de hacerle los envíos.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 18 pares de zapatos, 10 carteras, que los venderá a precios módicos para poder traer más productos en poco tiempo.
Con este negocio puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa porque un solo sueldo no alcanza para pagar los gastos del hogar, tiene un hijo que tiene muchos gastos en el colegio, su esposo es el que da el dinero para la comida del mes y algunos gastos basicos, ella se encarga de cubrir otros gastos.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de hacer que sus ideas se puedan hacer realidad.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the communal bank named "Las Orquideas", meaning "The Orchids". It is located in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 44 years old, married, and she has an adolescent son. 

Her first loan helped her to start up another business that did not require a large investment. Currently, she sells articles of clothing, wallets, shoes, and other accessories. She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for the last three years. The funds are invested in the purchase of merchandise. In Lima she has someone who takes care of all the shipments.

Her new loan is in the amount of S/.1500 nuevos soles and with it she will purchase: 18 pairs of shoes, and 10 wallets. She will resell the products at affordable prices to be able to bring in more products in less time.

She is able to help her husband with the household expenses through her business. One income is not enough to cover the household expenses. She has a son who has many school-related expenses. Her husband is who covers the food bill for the month and some other basic expenses. She takes care of the other expenses.

She is thankful to Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for giving her the opportunity to bring her ideas to light.

loans.use: to purchase wallets and shoes.

loans.name: Ramón Antonio

texts.es: "Dentro de algunos años me veo como Director de una escuela, siendo capaz de desarrollarme en el campo educativo dentro de la informática. Mi inspiración nace de ver a mis tios y tias como han logrado mejorar su situación económica y superarse aún viviendo en una situación económica muy pobre. Lo que hace que me destaque es que le dedico el mayor tiempo posible a mis estudios. Creo que soy diferente porque apoyo a mis compañeros en sus estudios y busco como animarles a seguir adelante. El desafío que he tenido ha sido el estudiar teniendo la responsabilidad de mantener mi hogar, lo pude superar levantándome muy temprano a estudiar y aprovechando cada tiempo libre en visitas a bibliotecas para cumplir con las exigencias de cada asignatura. El crédito lo usaré para pagar el curso de titulación para finalizar mi carrera."
texts.en: "Within a few years I see myself as the Principal of a school. I am able to develop myself in the field of informatics education. My inspiration comes from seeing my uncles and my aunts and how they have improved their financial situation. They managed to improve themselves despite living in a very poor financial situation. What makes me stand out is that I dedicate as much time as possible to my studies. I believe that I am different because I help my classmates with their studies and I look for ways to encourage them to keep going. The challenge that I have faced while I attend school is the responsibility of supporting my household. But I can overcome the challenge by getting up very early in the morning to study and I also make the most of any spare time with visits to the library to complete work associated with every class. I will use the loan to pay for my thesis course, to complete my studies."

loans.use: to pay for his thesis course, to complete his studies.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa, es socia del banco comunal Las Orquídeas del distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 59 años D. edad, está casad y tiene  dos hijos ya casados.
Su primer negocio lo inició con el préstamo D. Manuela Ramos.
Lleva seis años trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la costura, confecciona sabanas y lo hace en su casa, pero hace unas semanas, se fracturó la mano y no pueD. trabajar (vease la foto).
Con este nuevo préstamo D. S/.1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 11 metros D. tela para sabanas, 1 cono D. elástico, 1 rollo D. blonda, 6 metros   D. tela raso, hilos D. diferentes colores para los acabados.
Sus productos tienen precios razonables y también dá facilidades D. pago a sus clientes.
Está muy tranquila  porque muy pronto volverá a trabajar en lo que le gusta y podrá ayudar a su esposo quien es su gran compañero, con ellos vive uno D. sus nietos.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the communal bank named "Las Orquideas", meaning "The Orchids". It is located in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 59 years old, married and she has two children who are already married.

She started out her first business with a loan from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner)

She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for the past six years. She is a seamstress, making bed sheets from her home. A few weeks ago she broke her hand and she can no longer work (see photo). 

This new loan, amounting to S/.1000 nuevos soles, will be used to purchase: 11 meters of textile to make bed sheets, 1 roll of elastics, 1 roll of ribbon, 6 meters of lining fabric, and threads of various colors for the finishing.

She sells her products at reasonable prices and she also gives her clients the option of making payments. She is very happy because very soon she will be able to work again in what she loves. She will be able to continue to help her husband, her greatest companion. They live together with one of their grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase 11 meters of textile to make bed sheets, 1 roll of elastics, 1 roll of ribbon, 6 meters of lining fabric, and threads of various colors for the finishing.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es:
La señora Madeleine es socia del banco comunal La Lupuna del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña (menor en edad) en edad escolar.
Se dedica a la venta de bebidas en su casa, cuenta con una refrigeradora que es de gran ayuda, no es mucho lo que vende.  Está aprovechando que está libre, por el momento se está dedicando a este negocio, no gana mucho pero está haciendo el intento.  Debido a su condición de madre sola tiene que ver de qué manera solventa los gastos de su niña.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 jabas de gaseosa personal, 2 paquetes de gaseosa descartable, 1 paquete de agua mineral sin gas, 2 paquetes de gaseosa grande.
El próximo ciclo espera poder pedir un préstamo más alto para poder invertir en más mercadería.  Agradece a Manuela Ramos por todas las oportunidades que da a las mujeres de esta parte del país.
texts.en:
Madeleine is a member of the communal bank "La Lupuna". It is located in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 34 years old and she is the single mother of one girl (a minor) who is school aged.

She sells drinks from her home. She has a refrigerator and it is very helpful. She doesn't sell very much. She is profiting from her free time. At the moment she is managing this business and although she doesn't earn very much she's giving it a try. Given that she is a single mother she needs to find a way to provide for her daughter's expenses.

With her new loan, amounting to S/.1500 nuevos soles, she will purchase: 2 crates of soft drinks, 2 packages of drinking boxes, 1 package of mineral water, and 2 packages of large soft drink bottles. At the next loan cycle she hopes to be able to request a larger loan to invest in more merchandise. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for all of the opportunities given to women in this part of the country.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and mineral water.

loans.name: Pacifica

texts.es:
La señora Pacifica es socia del banco comunal Las orquídeas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos mayores de edad e independientes.
Para iniciar su negocio ha tenido que acudir a los préstamos que Manuela Ramos otorga a mujeres como ella desean emprender un negocio.
Es una de las fundadoras de este banco comunal, se dedica a la venta de comida y lo hace por las noches.
Ha tenido que acondicionar el patio de su casa para poder vender allí sin ningún problema.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 sacos de carbón, 3 fuentes nuevas, 4 embases para ají, 1 docena de vasos de vidrio, 6 jarras de medio litro.
Todas las noches saca sus productos a la venta, ella atiende sola.  Su esposo es comerciante y como todas las familias es el que mantiene el hogar, pero ella aporta también para otros gastos.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos todo este tiempo viene trabajando incansablemente para poder ayudar a que sus hijos terminen de estudiar, que es la única herencia que les pueden dejar.
texts.en:
Pacifica is a member of the communal bank named "Las Orquideas", meaning "The Orchids". It is located in Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 62 years old, married, and she has 5 children. They are all grown and independent.

To start up her business she needed to access a loan from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner). Loans are granted to women like her, who want to start up a business.

She is one of the founding members of the communal bank and she sell fast foods in the evenings.

She has had to remodel the patio of her house to be able to sell from there without any difficulty. With her new loan, amounting to S/. 1500, she will purchase: 2 sacks of charcoal, 2 new fountains, 4 bottles of chili, 1 dozen drinking glasses, 6 one-half liter pitchers.

Every evening she set outs to sell her products alone. Her husband is a merchant and like any other family, he supports the household. But she is also able to earn an income for other expenses. It is thanks to Manuela Ramos that she has been able to work tirelessly. She is able to support her children while they complete their schooling. It is the only inheritance she is able to leave them.

loans.use: 2 sacks of charcoal, 2 new fountains, and 4 bottles of chili.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: "La educación es muy importante para así poder forjar profesionales exitosos, emprendedores y con una mentalidad positiva en pos de contribuir de manera correcta a la sociedad. Me veo desempeñándome en un puesto laboral según mis capacidades dando lo mejor de mí para salir adelante. Me inspira Dios ya que sin él no somos nada. El amor que me tengo a mí y a mi familia, todos éstos factores son un motor esencial para avanzar y seguir adelante. Tengo deseos de estudiar, luchar, no darme por vencida ante las adversidades. es así como he finalizado los 5 años de la universidad por medio del esfuerzo, el empeño, la dedicación, responsabilidad y no me detendré, cumpliré mis metas sueños, sin darme por vencido"
texts.en: "Education is very important in forging successful professionals and entrepreneurs who have a positive mentality with respect to contributing to society. I am involved in a work sector that is within my capabilities and I give the best that I have to move forward. I am inspired by God because without Him we are nothing. My self esteem and the love that I have for my family are all contributors, essential to my motivation to advance and to move forward. I wish to go to school, to be accomplished, and to not give up in the face of adversities. It is through personal efforts, determination, dedication, and responsibility that I have spent the past 5 years in university. I will not stop and I will accomplish my goals and my dreams. I will never give up."

loans.use: to pay for her thesis and graduation expenses.

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR D. CCOYLLORITY D. YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito D. Yungaqui, Provincia D. Anta, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ubaldina; la socia tiene 52 años; la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales todos sus hijos son independientes; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales, la socia se dedica a la venta D. animales como vacas, toros, la socia también elabora queso, leche, la socia tiene 8 vacas lecheras y ahora ella desea comprar una vaca. La socia se dedica  a la compra y crianza D. animales; la socia comprara una vaca ternera, la socia elabora quesos y leche sacados D. sus mismas vacas; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. vaca. 

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Taytacha Senor D. Ccoyllority D. Yungaqui". It is located in the district of Yungaqui, in the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Ubaldina. She is 52 years old, married, and she has 4 children, two of whom are independent. She buys and sells livestock. She sells livestock such as cows and bulls. She also makes cheese, and milk. She has 8 dairy cows and she now wishes to buy another cow. She buys and raises livestock. She will purchase a calf. she makes cheeses and milk from her own cows. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of another cow.

She is very satisfied and very thankful for the support that is provided to her through this manner. She is committed to making her loan payments at the established frequency.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy; la socia tiene 33 años; la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 1 mes de edad; la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores,  y a la agricultura, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivo de maíz, también cría animales como cuyes, ovejas, chanchos, vacas. La socia compra y vende animales en las diferentes ferias, ella desea  invertir el crédito en la compra de animales menores, la socia comprara cuyes, al por mayor y también comprara gallinas para criar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores ella comprara cuyes y gallinas.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nancy, 33, belongs to the “Taytacha Señor de Ccoyllority de Yungaqui” communal bank that’s in Yungaqui District in Anta Province, Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and two children whose ages are 4 years and 1 month respectively.  She raises small farm animals and she farms.  She has fields planted with corn.  She also raises animals like guinea pigs, pigs, sheep and cows.  She buys and sells the animals in various markets.  She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of small animals; she will buy guinea pigs at wholesale and she’ll also buy chicks to raise.  She needs the loan to buy small farm animals; she will buy guinea pigs and chicks.

She is very satisfied and grateful for the support she’s been given through this means and commits to repay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install safety devices on windows and doors.

loans.name: Alejandrina Natividad

texts.es: Alejandrina tiene 23 años y tiene una hija (Yamiled de 1 año y 5 meses), ella nació en la ciudad de Echarate provincia de la Convención (Cusco, Perú), vive en la comunidad de Chogona a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Quillabamba. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio y ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. El sueño de Alejandrina es abrir otra tienda.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 23, has a daughter (Yamiled, seventeen months months old).  Alejandrina was married in the city of Echarate, La Convención Province, (Cusco, Perú).  She lives in the community of Chogona which is 45 minutes from the city of Quillabamba.

She has a small grocery store at home; she’s had it for a year and does very well.  On this opportunity she needs the loan to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles and other things, for example.  Alejandrina’s dream is to open a second store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juanita es  una persona  trabajadora  y  muy  responsable,  y  se  dedica  a la venta  de  tamales, actualmente  ella  requiere  hacerle   frente  a los  gastos  de  graduación  de  su    hija  y lamentablemente   no cuenta  con   el capital  suficiente   para  hacerle   frente , es  por  ello  que   necesita   de  nuestro  apoyo  para  realizar  la  compra  de    materia   prima  para   elaborar  tamales  y  venderlos  entre  sus  clientes, agradece el  apoyo   brindado para la realización de su proyecto  ya  que  el estudio  y  educacion es  la  mayor  herencia  que   puede  dejar  a  su  hija.
texts.en: Juanita is a hard working, very responsible person.  She sells tamales.  She wants to be able to take care of her daughter’s graduation expenses but regrettably lacks sufficient funds to do so.  Because of this she needs our help to buy raw materials to make tamales to sell among her customers.  She appreciates the support provided to carry out her project because schooling and education is the best inheritance a parent can leave her daughter.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas tiene 45 años y tiene cuatro hijas, ella nació en la ciudad de Echarate provincia de la Convención (Cusco, Perú), vive en la comunidad de Chogona a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Quillabamba. Ella se dedica al cultivo de cafe, cacao y frutas. Ella también se dedica a la venta de comida. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. (Quillabamba es ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.)
texts.en:
Felicitas, 45, has 4 children. She was born in the city of Echarate in the province of Convencion (Cusco, Peru). She lives in Chogonga, 45 minutes from the city of Quillabamba. She grows cafe, cacao and fruit. She also sells food. On this occasion she needs a loan to buy products like rice, sugar, noodles and other things. 

Quillabamba is the provincial capital of La Convencion and is an important commercial center for the valleys of Lares and La Convencion. The primary activities there are chocolate, coffee, cacao and fruits.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, noodles and other things.

loans.name: Juliana Lizbeth

texts.es:
La señora Juliana y su esposo el señor Ángel Carlos tiene tres hijos que actual mente están estudiando y desean que terminen una carrera profesional.
Solicitan un préstamo para poder pagar las inscripciones de la escuela y comprar de los útiles que son libros, cuadernos y también los uniformes.
Doña Juliana pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como empleada de la compañía de gas, ya que el señor Ángel Carlos se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que recibe de su trabajo. 
Desean fortalecer y mejorar el porvenir de sus tres hijos y así tenga un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Juliana and her husband, Angel Carlos, have 3 children who are currently in school and they want them to become professionals. They are asking for a loan to be able to pay school entrance fees and to buy supplies like books, notebooks and uniforms.

Juliana will pay the loan with her salary from her job at the gas company, since Angel Carlos covers the family's living costs with the income from his job.

They want to strengthen and improve the future of their three children.

loans.use: to pay school costs.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: El Sr. Leonardo es una persona que labora en una compañía desde hace ya diez años, el y su apreciable esposa viven   solos   ya  que  sus   hijos  han  formado  su  propia  familia ,  día  con  día   se  han esforzado  para    comprar   su  vivienda y  en esta  ocasión  ellos  requieren  acondicionar  su  domicilio ya que  desean  instalar  la  barda  a su  hogar, agradecen  el  apoyo para  la realización de su proyecto  ya  que  ven  en  el  crédito la  posibilidad   de   ver  realizado  su sueño    y  de  proteger  su  vivienda.
texts.en: Leonardo has worked at his company for 10 years now. He and his esteemed wife live alone now that their children have their own families. They have worked hard day after day to buy their home and now they need to fix it up. They want to install a high fence around the house.  They are thankful for the support to make this project happen since they can see that this loan gives them the possibility to see their dream realized and to protect their home.

loans.use: to build a fence around their home.

loans.name: Trinidad (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Trinidad está formado por 13 mujeres quienes son amigas y vecinas, amables, carismáticas, luchadoras y trabajadoras, laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias. Viven por la parroquia de Turi, parroquia que es muy visitada por ser el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica al comercio, agricultura y cría de animales.

Una de las socias es la Señora. Cecilia, vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 28 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad quienes estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos los que los vende en la ciudad. También trabaja como empleada domestica actividad que la realiza de lunes a viernes de 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos.

Su meta es  terminar su casa.

Los niños que aparecen en la foto son hijos de algunas de las socias.
texts.en:
The 'Trinidad' community bank is made up of 13 women who are friends and neighbors.  They are kind, charismatic, tenacious and hard working.  They all work in different business activities which allow them to contribute to their households financially and get their families ahead in life.  They live in Turi parish which receives a lot of visitors because it is a viewpoint for the city of Cuenca.  The locals work in sales, farming and livestock raising.

One of the members of this bank is Cecilia who lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  She is 28 years old, married, and has two children from her marriage.  They are 10 and 5 and attend a school in the city.  Her husband works in construction.  They own the house in which they live.

Our member works raising pigs and chickens which she sells in the city.  She also works as a domestic employee.  She does this work from 8.00am to 4.00pm, Monday to Friday.

The community bank are on their fourth loan and Cecilia will invest her money in buying pigs.  Her goal is to finish her house.

The children who appear in the photo belong to some of the bank members.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita es  una persona  muy trabajadora  nos  comenta  que  hace   tiempo  intentaron  robar  en  su  domicilio  , ocasionándole  daños  a  las  ventas y  en  el  techo  de   una  habitación,  es por  ello  que   requiere  de nuestra   ayuda  para reparar los  imperfectos  ocasionado  por  los ladrones, agradece el  apoyo  brindado para la  realización de  su  proyecto y  la  posibilidad  de ofrecer a su  familia una  mayor  seguridad.
texts.en: Margarita is a very hard-working person.  She tells us that some time ago some people tried to burgle her home.  They caused damage to the windows and the roof of one room.  For this reason, she needs our help to repair the damage caused by the burglars.  She is grateful for the support she is being given to carry out her project and the possibility she has to provide her family with greater security.

loans.use: to buy windows and repair her roof

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Luís Antonio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Luís Antonio le esta haciendo falta terminar un cuarto ya que tiene poco tiempo de casado y quiere ampliar mas la casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material de construcción como es block, varilla, cemento y arena, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe como empleado de una maquiladora en el aria de producción.
texts.en:
Luís Antonio needs to finish a room in his home.  He hasn't been married for very long and he would like to extend his house.  He is requesting a loan so that he can buy construction materials such as blocks, rods, cement and sand.  Right now he doesn't have the money he needs.  He will make this improvement outside of work hours. 

Luís Antonio plans to repay his loan with the salary that he receives from his job in a cross-border assembly plant.  He works in production.

loans.use: to finish a room

loans.name: El Pedregal De San Jorge (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Jorge  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito El Pedregal De San Jorge.
 
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les servir  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos  pueden mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Enma, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 16 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ganarse algo por sus propios medios se dedica a preparar y vender comida. Ella prepara bocadillos y platos para fiestas, además de pastelillos, morcillas rellenas, bollos entre otros platos y bocadillos deliciosos, todo lo que ella prepara es bajo pedido, nos cuenta que todas las semanas tiene pedidos y que trabaja los tres últimos días de la semana, viene realizando esta actividad ya por seis años y que le va muy bien ya que sus platos son los mejores asegura.
 
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar sus deliciosos platos. Este es el primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the "El Pedregal de San Jorge" community bank meet in San Jorge, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

This is a group of people who decided to come together and form a loan group which would be very helpful as they can use the loans to improve their small businesses.  They work in a range of different business activities such as farming, general commerce, services, etc.
 
Here we meet 43 year-old Enma who is married and has three children aged 17, 16 and 3.  Her two eldest are in high school.

Enma is a very good housewife who, in order to make some money herself, prepares and sells food.  She makes sandwiches and dishes for parties.  She also makes 'pastelillos' (similar to empanadas), 'morcillas rellenas' (blood sausage), bread rolls and other delicious dishes and sandwiches.  She makes all her food to order.  She tells us that she has orders every week and she works the three last days of every week.  She has been in this business for six years and things are going very well as she assures us that her dishes are the best.

Enma will use this loan to buy food products to prepare her delicious dishes.  This is her first loan cycle with her community bank and she likes it because the loans are disbursed quickly.

Enma's dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Veronica Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Verónica, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hermosa hija de cinco años de edad, la misma que recién en este año empezó a estudiar en una  escuela del sector. Su esposo es tecnólogo en computación.

Nuestra amiga es maestra por contrato en una escuela en San Jacinto, pero también tiene un negocio propio en el cual se dedica a la venta de confitería, helados, sodas, aguas, bocadillos elaborados para picar entre otras cosas, ella tiene un pequeño bar en la estación de servicios en Charapoto. También ofrece el servicio de cabinas telefónicas, nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio por más de siete años y le ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería va a comprar, papas fritas, tostitos, sodas, aguas, energizantes entre otras cosas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace ya cuatro años y le gusta porque los créditos le han sacado de muchos apuros económicos.
 
Sus metas son tener una casa y local propios pues donde vive y tiene su local es alquilado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'San Esteban' community bank meets in the city of Charapoto.  This place is known for its traditional culture and also for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 32 year-old Verónica who is married and has a beautiful 5 year-old daughter.  Just this year, her daughter started attending an elementary school in their neighborhood.  Her husband is a computer engineer.

Our friend is a teacher at a school in San Jacinto.  However, she also owns her own business where she sells confectionery, iced treats, soda, water, sandwiches, etc.  She owns a small bar in a service station in Charapoto.  She also offers a telephone service.  She tells us that she has been in this business for more than seven years and it is doing very well.

Verónica will use this loan to buy more merchandise.  She will buy chips, tostitos, soda, water, energy drinks, etc.  She has been a member of her community bank for four years and she likes it because the loans have gotten her out of many financial tight spots. 

Verónica's goals are to own her own home and business premises as she currently rents both.

loans.use: to buy chips, tostitos, soda, water, energy drinks, etc.

loans.name: Enelita

texts.en:
Enelita is married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Enelita is 43 years old and has one child who is in school.

Enelita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Enelita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials.

Enelita has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Enelita would like to save enough money to purchase an additional fishing boat and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este hermoso lugar conocimos a la señora Digna. Tiene 59 años de edad está casada y fruto de  relación tienen  cuatro hijos ya todos son mayores de edad pero el menor de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa.
 
Es un ama de casa que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (perfumería, artículos de belleza y accesorios para damas), también hace poco empezó a vender ropa por catalogo y según nos cuenta ha tenido muchas ventas de estos productos y estas ventas las realiza al mismo tiempo que vende sus otros productos, su forma  de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres a cuatro días por semana en sus entregas y cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada dia domingo. Nos cuenta que lleva en la actividad comercial  por más de diez años y que ha tenido sus altas y bajas pero nunca se ha rendido porque es una mujer muy luchadora.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cosméticos, cremas y bisutería. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben para seguir en sus negocios. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'San Esteban' community bank meet in the town of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and also for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

In this beautiful place, we meet 59 year-old Digna who is married and has four children who are all now grown up.  Her youngest still lives with her.  Her husband works in a company.

Digna is a housewife who, in order to help with her household expenses, sells Avon products (perfumes, beauty products and ladies' accessories).  She also recently started selling clothes through catalogs.  She tells us that she has sold a lot of these products and makes these sales at the same time as she sells her other products.  She makes her sales door to door and works three to four days a week, delivering goods and collecting payment.  She leaves her goods with her customers on credit and collects payment every Sunday.  She tells us that she has been buying and selling for more than ten years.  The business has had its ups and downs but she has never given up because she is a fighter.

Digna will use this loan to buy clothes, perfume, cosmetics, creams and costume jewelry.  She is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it because of the help they receive to continue in their businesses.

Digna's dream is to keep going with her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfume, cosmetics, creams and costume jewelry

loans.name: Richard Vicente

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos  a Richard, tiene 24 años  de edad, está soltero y estudia para laboratorista clínico  en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí,  actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres. Para el este es su cuarto ciclo en el Grupo de Crédito y nos cuenta que le gusta ya que con los créditos él ha podido mejorar su negocio el mismo que le da lo suficiente para continuar sus estudios. 

El tiene un pequeño local en sus casa en donde vende varias cosas como helados, aguas, sodas, golosinas y además también tiene unas vitrinas donde exhibe ropa y zapatos de todo tipo, allí el trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 14h00 que tiene que ir a la universidad a seguir sus estudios, nos cuenta que le gusta su trabajo ya que además de ganarse lo necesario para sus gastos, este también le da el tiempo necesario para estudiar y cumplir con las exigencias que estos requieren. Su mercadería la compara en Portoviejo en un lugar que le dan ropa seleccionada y a buen precio, lleva con su local un año  y empezó con uno de los créditos pero desde hace cuatro años el ya vendía lo que es ropa pero puerta a puerta.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, zapatos, golosinas y todo tipo de productos que vende en su local.

Sus metas son terminar sus estudios y tener su propio laboratorio para ser útil a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'San Esteban' community bank meet in the town of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 24 year-old Richard who is single and studying to become a laboratory technician in the Universidad Técnica de Manabí.  He currently lives in his parents' home.  This is his fourth loan cycle with his community bank and he tells us that he likes it because the credits have enabled him to improve his business which provides him with enough money to continue his studies.

Richard has small business premises in his home where he sells a variety of goods such as iced treats, water, soda and candies.  He also has some display cases where he displays all kinds of clothes and shoes.  He works there every day from 8.00am to 2.00pm which is when he has to go to university to study.  He tells us that he enjoys his work because, in addition to earning the money he needs to cover his expenses, it also gives him time to study and meet the demands that his studies place on him.  He buys his merchandise in Portoviejo, in a place that gives him selected clothes at a good price.  He has run his premises for one year and started out with one of his loans.  However, he has been selling clothes for four years (he used to sell door to door).

Richard will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, shoes, candies and all kinds of products that he sells in his store.

Richard's goals are to finish his studies and to own his own laboratory so that he play a useful role in society.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, shoes, candies, etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 45 years old and married with two children. She runs a sari-sari (retail) store in the Philippines and works hard to provide for her family. Elvira has been running her business for the past year and she also earns an income from selling vegetables. She has previously borrowed and repaid three NWTF loans.

Elvira is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy merchandise to sell such as detergent, snack foods, vegetables, and other items. She aspires to save enough money to rent a space in the public market.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like detergent, snack foods,  and vegetables

loans.name: Hicela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Hicela, ella tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos tres mayores de edad y uno de 17 años, los mismos que estudian tres en Universidad y el menor este año termina el colegio, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es Ing. Eléctrico.

Nuestra amiga es maestra de un centro educativo en Charapoto desde hace algunos años atrás, ella realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo que además de trabajar en obras de su profesión también se dedica a la agricultura, el siembra en toda época del año,  siembra cultivos de acuerdo a la temporada de ciclo corto ya que cuenta con el terreno e instrumentos para esto, siembra arroz, sandia, melón, pimiento, tomate entre otros productos, los mismos que en tiempo de cosecha los lleva a los mercados de la provincia para venderlos  a comerciantes que luego distribuyen al menudeo a los clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar semillas,  insecticidas, abonos y otros químicos necesarios para obtener una buena cosecha. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 10 años y le gusta porque con los créditos su esposo puede financiarse para sus cultivos.
 
Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos sean muy buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'San Esteban' community bank meet in the town of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 47 year-old Hicela who is married and has four children.  Three of her children are already grown up and one is 17.  Three are studying at university and her youngest will finish high school this year.  All of her children still live with her.  Her husband is an electrical engineer.

Our friend is a teacher in an educational center in Charapoto.  She has worked there for some years.  She is taking a loan to help her husband who, in addition to working in his profession, also farms.  He sows crops year round, according to the short-cycle season, as he has the land and tools he needs for this.  He grows rice, watermelons, melons, peppers, tomatoes and other crops.  At harvest time, he takes his produce to the markets in their province to sell to salespeople who then distribute them to customers retail.

Hicela's husband will use this loan to buy seeds, insecticides, manure and chemicals that he needs to obtain a good harvest.  Hicela has been a member of her community bank for ten years and she likes it because her husband is able to use the loans to grow his crops.

Hicela's dream is to see her children become very good professionals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, manure and chemicals

loans.name: Lorena Del Rocío

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lorena, tiene 34 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación que tuvo tiene tres hijos de 17, 11 y 1 año, su hijo de 11 años estudia en escuela y el mayor trabaja.

Ella junto a su hijo se dedican al comercio, ellos venden mariscos, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que antes ellos recorrían la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos pero que luego que quedo embarazada de su último hijo ella solo vende en su casa y que su hijo es el que recorre con los productos en una moto de su propiedad por la ciudad y por los campos más cercanos, ellos llevan más de cinco años dedicados a esta actividad y gracias a Dios les va bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, conchas, camarón, cangrejos, langostinos, etc. ya sea en el mercado mayoristas en Portoviejo o en Manta  hasta donde a veces  viajan para comprar mejores productos y más barato. Lleva dos años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado.
 
Sus metas son comprar un carro para llevar más productos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'San Esteban' community bank meet in the town of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 34 year-old Lorena who is separated but has three children from her relationship.  Her children are aged 17, 11 and 1.  Her 11 year-old son is in school and her eldest son works.

Together with her son, Lorena sells seafood.  Our friend tells us that they used to go round the streets of town selling their products but since she became pregnant with her youngest child she now only sells from home.  Her son is the one who now drives a motorcycle that he owns through the streets of the town and the nearby countryside selling their products.  They have been in this business for more than five years and, thanks to God, it is doing well.

Lorena will use this loan to buy fish, seafood, shrimp, crabs, prawns, etc. either in the wholesale market in Portoviejo or in Manta.  Sometimes they travel there to buy better products more cheaply.  Lorena has been a member of her community bank for two years.  She likes it because of the help that they have given her.

Lorena's goal is to buy a car so that she can transport more goods.

loans.use: to buy fish, shellfish, shrimp, crabs, prawns, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Arcelia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 14 y 9 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo tiene una panadería.

Ella junto  a su esposo tienen  una panadería en la cual además de pan de distintos modelos y sabores también preparan deliciosas tortas, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que su faena empieza desde las 5h00 que comienzan a hornear el pan para que cuando lleguen sus cliente todo esté listo y ellos puedan llevar el pan a sus  hogares, ella además de esto también tienen una mini tienda que también con la ayuda de sus esposo y sus hijos atienden, nos cuenta que llevan más de 17 años con su negocio desde que se caso con su esposo y le ha ido muy bien a pesar de la competencia.

Este crédito es para comprar harina, azúcar, sal, levaduras y otros ingredientes para preparar el pan y además para surtir su tienda. Lleva tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ellos pueden comprar al por mayor y les sale más barato todo.
 
Sus metas son ver realizados a sus hijos como profesionales.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'San Esteban' community bank meet in the town of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 36 year-old Carmen who is married and has three children aged 17, 14 and 9.  Her two eldest children are in high school and her youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband owns a bakery.

Together with her husband, Carmen owns a bakery in which, as well as making different types and flavors of bread, they also make delicious cakes.  Our friend tells us that her work starts at 5.00am, when they start baking bread so that when their customers arrive everything is ready and they can take their bread home to their families.  In addition to this work, Carmen also has a small store which she serves in with the help of her husband and children.  She tells us that she has in her business for more than 17 years, since she got married, and it is doing very well, in spite of the competition.

Carmen will use this loan to buy flour, sugar, salt, yeast and other ingredients for making her bread and also to stock her store.  She has been a member of her community bank for three years and she likes it because the loans mean that they can buy products wholesale which makes everything work out cheaper.

Carmen's goal is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Martha, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad los  mismos que  estudian en  escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Ella lleva seis años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe al ser socia del banco.

Ella comparte su tiempo entre su hogar y su negocio ya que se dedica también a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus conocidos cuando necesitan alguna prenda de vestir. Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas, ella aprovecha que sus hijos a esta hora están en la escuela para realizar su trabajo fuera de su casa, deja a crédito sus productos   y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil una vez al mes. Tiene diez  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Sus sueños es seguir trabajando y darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'San Esteban' community bank meet in the town of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 39 year-old Martha who is married and has two children, aged 10 and 8, who are attending school.  Her husband is a fisherman.  Martha has been a member of her community bank for six years and she likes it for the benefits that she receives from being a member.

Martha divides her time between her home and her business.  She sells all types of clothes door to door.  She also sells from her home where her acquaintances come when they need to buy clothes.  She works every morning.  She makes the most of the fact that her children are in school in the morning and uses that time to carry out her work outside of her home.  She leaves her goods on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil once a month.  Martha has been in this business for ten years now and it is doing quite well.

Martha will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

Martha's dreams are to continue working and to provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes

loans.name: Winangun Sari Group

texts.en:
The Winangun Sari group is made up of seven men who are neighbors in the same village in Baturiti, central Bali. The group is seeking a loan of 14,000,000 IDR, and each member will receive 2,000,000 IDR. The group was formed out of these men’s common interest in raising rabbits to support their families, and out of their interest in education on best practices for rabbit raising. This is their first loan with Kiva partner, MUK.
I Nengah, aged 50, is the head of the Winangun Sari group. He is married and has two children, aged 25 and 13. His younger son is in school and his older son is already married. He plans to use his share of the loan to purchase a pair of large rabbits, which he will breed. Over the six-month loan period, he hopes to have three litters of bunnies. He will sell some of the rabbits as pets after 20 days, and others as food after a few months. With his income, he hopes to be able to improve his economic life.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of large rabbits.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap, 41, is a worker. His wife is a cook in a hotel. Their income is $6 per day. He has two children, 12 and 9 years old. Every month, he has to spend $60 on food, $7 on electricity, $20 on school fee and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $400 to repair his house so that he can have a better house to live in. In the future, he plans to sell groceries in the market with his wife because they are getting older. He just wants to get a shop to make a living. For his children, he wants to support them in their study so they at least finish high school.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov is a security guard. His wife stays at home. A granddaughter also stays with his family. His income is $5 per day. Every month, he has to spend around $70 on family expenses. He would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. When he gets a motorbike it will help him to not be late for work as he will be able to travel to work by himself. In the future he expects to get a souvenir shop for his wife to help earn money.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Trob

texts.en: Trob, 33, is an animal seller. Her husband works in SIMAX organization. Their income is $7 per day. They have 4 children, three of whom are studying. Every month she has to spend $37.5 on food, $10 on electricity and $12 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy pigs and pigfeed. Previously she was a cake seller but her income was not enough to support her. Therefore, she changed to raising animals because she saw other people doing this and earning a good income. She tries to follow this example and also become successful in this career. In the future she plans to raise more pigs and other animals to sell so that she can support all her children through university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy pigs to feed for selling

loans.name: Pompia

texts.en:
Pompia is a 60-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has had a sari-sari (variety) store for 15 years. She sells items like milk, spices and softdrinks. She also sells pig feed to the people in her community. Pompia earns about 6000 PHP per month.

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as softdrinks, canned goods and pig feed. Pompia hopes that this loan will help expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as softdrinks, canned goods and pigfeed

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna, 47 years old, sells soya sauce. Her husband is a cake seller and their income is $8 per day. She has two children, 18 and 12. One is studying and the other works in a hotel earning $4 per day. Every month she has to spend $75 on food, $15 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $15 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a Tok Tok (a motorbike with a cart attached) for her son to run a Tok Tok service. This loan can help her son to have a career to support himself. In the future, she plans to buy a store for her daughter to sell groceries in the market.

loans.use: To buy a Tok Tok for her son

loans.name: 1 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa has a retail business selling dried food. She is requesting a loan to purchase processed seafood to resell.

Hoa is 57 years old and is married with 3 children.
She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 1 Nam Ngan solidarity group. 
Hoa lives with 1 dependant in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase dried food to resell

loans.name: Sovong

texts.en: Sovong, 21 years old, is a Khmer traditional wedding musician and also buys old motorbikes to resell at a profit. His income is $7 per day. His wife stays home taking care of their children. Every month he has to spend $50 on food, $7 on electricity and $10 on other family expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1000 to purchase old motorbikes for resale. His motorbike reselling business is going well and he wants to expand by buying more motorbikes when he has enough money.

loans.use: To buy old motorbikes for resale

loans.name: 15 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hiền operates a food stall. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry to process and resell.

Hiền is 39 years old and is married with 2 children.
She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 15 Điện Biên  solidarity group. 
Hiền lives with 2 dependants in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hiền has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hiền has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main hardship she faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her children to do well in school and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase poultry to process and resell

loans.name: Treat

texts.en: Treat, 30 years old, is an animal seller. Her husband is a medical doctor in the village. Their income is $13 per day. She has 5 children: three are studying and the other two are too small to go to school and they stay home with their mother. Every month she has to spend $37.5 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy more pigs to raise and sell. She raised pigs before but she lost the profit because no one helped her to do it when she had her third child. Now she wants to do it again because she believes she can make a good profit. She plans to send her children to university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 56 years old and is a married woman with 6 children. She is a farmer who tills land in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She grows rice and vegetables. Cirila sells her harvest at her town's market. As well as farming, Cirila also owns and manages a sari sari (variety) store. She sells items like shampoo, soap and other daily use products.

Cirila has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Cirila hopes to have a stable business to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Sambath, 40 years old, sells groceries and offers loans to others to get interest with her husband. Their income is $7 per day. She has 4 children: three are studying and one is working in a factory earning $2 per day. Every month she has to spend $41 on food, $20 on rent, $10 on school fees and $12 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to continue to provide loans to others to get interest. In the future she wants to enlarge her grocery store by buying more goods to sell to get more profit. In that way she can save some money to buy a plot of land to build a house to live in because, now, her family is living in a rented house.

loans.use: To provide loans to others to earn interest

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.en:
Ikrom is a responsible and hardworking man. He is married and is the father of three children. He is the sole breadwinner and would like to provide for his children needs. Ikrom is a taxi driver and he services his local city. He has been in this business for more than a year. Ikrom would like a loan of 8500 TJS to purchase a car to make a good profit.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul is a member of this group. She is 39 and is married to a construction worker. Together with her husband she brings up five sons. The older sons study at school and the younger ones are in kindergarten. To earn money to meet the family's needs, Nazgul breeds livestock and resells it at a higher price. In this way she earns 5000 soms per month. With the loan Nazgul wants to purchase hay to feed livestock. In the future she wants to give all her sons a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a widow. She has three grown children. Valentina runs a small business selling clothing and merchandise in a little store close to the central market in her home town of Melitopol. Valentina has been in this trade for 17 years. She has 40,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas a month. Valentina’s business goal is to develop her business further and startup at one more business location.

Valentina is seeking a 8,000 Grivnya loan to purchase assorted merchandise for the current summer season. She is very responsible when it comes to loan repayments. She can be characterized as a hard-working and circumspect individual with clear vision and a determined nature. These personal characteristics help Valentina to succeed in her business endeavors and to repay the current loan without any problems.

loans.use: to purchase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman runs a small business selling automotive lighting systems and accessories. He has been in this business for ten years and has been quite successful. He lives with his wife and daughter in Berdansk, a city on the Sea of Azov. 

Roman is a very polite and affable businessman. His kiosk offers a variety of exclusive, high-quality items. Exceptional prices and a willingness to make sure that his customer’s needs are met help him stay competitive and maintain a loyale clientele base. The fact that he has a convenient location for his business also adds to the success of his trade. 

Roman is requesting a loan of 12,000 UAH to increase the assortment of what he offers and to expand his inventory. He believes that financial assistance in combination with his hard work and perseverance will contribute much to the successful growth and increased profitability of his business.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of what he offers and to expand his inventory

loans.name: Mosharif

texts.ru: Мошариф жительница района Яван. Ей 44 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее сын на заработках в России, а ее муж занимается растениеводством. Сама Мошариф при доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для повторного посева.
texts.en: Mosharif is a resident of the Yavan region. She is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. Her son is now working in Russia and her husband is in agriculture. Mosharif has a plot of land by her house where she grows vegetables for sale. She has been in this business for eight years. She is taking out the loan for the second sowing.

loans.use: to buy seeds for the second sowing

loans.name: Mehrojidin

texts.en:
Mehrojidin is a hardworking man. He is married and the father of three children. His wife is a housewife. Mehrojidin is engaged in the buying and selling of cattle at a local market called “Vahdat”. He purchases cattle at 1800 to 2000 TJS then sells them at 2000 to 2200 TJS. With this premium he earns money and feeds his family. He has been running this business for ten years. With the loan that Mehrojidin has requested he plans to purchase cattle in order to make a good profit.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Suhayl

texts.ru: Сухайл проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат. Детей не имеет. У него среднее образование. Он более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом имеет продуктовый магазин. Он берет кредит для покупки масла, муки, арбузов, дыни, картофеля и семян. Сухайл хочет одновременно заняться растениеводством. Он намерен у себя дома выращивать овощи для продажи.
texts.en: Suhayl lives in the Yavan district.  He is 26 years old, married and has no children.  He has a secondary education.  He has been involved in retail sales for over six years and has a store near his house.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of butter, flour, watermelons, honeydew, potatoes and seeds.  Suhayl wants to also get involved in agriculture.  He plans to grow vegetables at home for subsequent sale.

loans.use: to purchase butter, flour, watermelons, honeydew, potatoes and seeds

loans.name: Saiffullo

texts.en:
Saiffullo is a responsible father of three children. Since 2000 he has been running a business producing iron-metal products such as doors, window lattice and lattice fences. He started his business with his own capital and now he would like to increase his working capital. Saiffullo would like to request a loan of 12,000 TJS for purchasing metal strips, paint and plywood in order to expand his business.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy metal strips, paint and plywood.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 27 years old and lives in Trinidad, Bohol. He has run a motorcycle taxi business for ten years. This business earns 4,500 PHP per month.
Felix is asking for a loan to purchase motorcycle parts such as tires, brake rods and bearings. This will help him keep his motorcycle in good condition. In the future, Felix hopes to buy another motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts such as tires, brake rods and bearings.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a married mother of five from the Negev. She completed high school and went on to to study childcare. She has a certification in childcare and currently works part-time in a kindergarten as a teacher's helper. For the last few years she has run an after school care program for elementary school students in her village.  The after school care is located in two rooms of her home, which allows for activities and studying by the children. Jihad wants to improve and expand her after school care before the start of the 2011-2012 school year. Jihad has gained a strong reputation as a caring professional who provides a loving, nurturing environment for children.

Jihad needs the loan for small renovations, and to purchase equipment including games, art supplies, a closet for storing equipment, shelves and a wall-to-wall carpet.

Jihad uses part of her income to pay for the university expenses  of one of her sons, who is abroad. She wants to send each of her children to study but here in Israel since she does not like the separation from her children. With her after school care and the increased income, she is earning money to see that each of her children gains an education.

loans.use: to pay for small renovations and new equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate an entertainment tent, put down concrete and redo the floor.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is from the northern city of Tamra and has been working for over 30 years as a seamstress. During all her years she took courses and taught herself in order to advance her skills. After years of receiving compliments and being encouraged by customers and friends, Huda started offering seamstress and tailor services in the afternoon. She has also begun to create some of her own designs. Huda wants to further establish her microbusiness and expand her services. Huda works with her sister-in-law at her business and has gained more and more clients wanting to purchase the clothes she creates.

She needs this loan to purchase a more professional sewing machine.

Huda wants to continue expanding her business. She continues to take design classes and wants to branch out into wedding designs and evening dresses.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Adalhia

texts.en: Adalhia is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Adalhia has a business selling grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for five years. Adalhia has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs. She has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2009. In the future, Adalhia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Elena has a food shop or eatery that sells several kinds of dishes. She has had this business for four years. Elena has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed to make her dishes. Elena has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to make dishes.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Lanie is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Lanie has a food shop or eatery that sells different kinds of dishes. She has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed to make the dishes. Lanie has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to make dishes.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Merlinda has a beauty shop that provides hair dressing services, pedicures and manicures. She has had this business for five years. Merlinda has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy materials needed for the beauty parlor. She has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Nenita has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for six years. Nenita has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods and beverages. Nenita has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en: Esperanza is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Esperanza has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for six years. She has requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks. Esperanza has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Eturalde

texts.en:
Eturalde is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 1 child. He has a shop that sells vegetables like tomatoes and cabbages. He has had this business for 5 years. 

He requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy additional vegetables to sell. Eturalde has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Муродали проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 23 года. Холост. У него высшее образование, он технолог. Муродали арендует помещение, где занимается починкой мобильных телефонов. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения запчастей мобильных телефонов.
texts.en: Murodali lives in the Vose district.  He is 23 years old and single.  He has a higher education; he is a technician.  Murodali leases a space, where he repairs mobile phones.
