He has been involved in this type of business for seven years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of spare parts for mobile phones.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for mobile phones

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 2 children. Teresita has a retail shop that sells vegetables like tomatoes and bell peppers. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy vegetables to sell. Teresita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Tereza

texts.en: Maria Tereza is a 44-year-old hardworking woman who owns a permanent house in Karuguuza, Uganda. She is the breadwinner of a family that has eight people, and her desire is to set up an income generating activity that can sustain them. For 10 years, Maria Tereza has been dealing in local gin, both buying and selling, and from this business she has been able to build a house and buy plots of land. She faces a challenge of defaulters, but in spite of this she wants to begin purifying local gin into improved gins to sell. Maria Tereza needs the loan facility to repackage alcohol.

loans.use: To repackage alcohol.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
Bakhtiyor lives and works in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is married and the father of two children. Bakhtiyor sells jewelry, souvenirs and hair clips at the market of “Korvon” in Dushanbe city. He tries to keep his family in a good living condition. That’s why he would like to get a loan of $3000 USD for purchasing jewelry, souvenirs and hair clips in order to expand his business and make a good profit to meet his family's needs.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy jewelry and souvenirs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
39-year-old Helen earns a living through farming. She is married and has 5 children. The oldest child is 12 while the youngest is only 2.

Helen started farming 8 years ago. She grows rice crops and vegetables. She sells her harvest at her town's market. Helen works hard to help provide their household needs and send her children to school. She applied for a loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

Helen is hoping that her farming business will grow. She also hopes for her children to finish college someday and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. She has a retail shop that sells spices and vegetables like tomatoes and bell peppers. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional vegetables to sell. Marcelina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman with 6 children. She is 59 years old and has a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like eggs, canned goods and sugar. She also sells hog feeds and rice to the people in her community. She usually earns about 3,000 PHP (~$75) per month with her business.

Josefina is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, hog feed and rice.

In the future, Josefina hopes to have a bigger store. She also hopes that her two younger children will be able to finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, hog feed and rice.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a shop that sells vegetables like tomatoes and cabbages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy vegetables to sell. Antonieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for 3 years. 

She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, beverages and snacks to sell. Dioscora has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
Lyra is a married woman with 5 children. The oldest child is 16 years old and the youngest is 9. Lyra's husband is a farmer.

Lyra has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 12 years. She sells items like sugar, vinegar, coffee and canned goods to the people in her community. She also helps her husband sell his harvest at the market. She works hard to help provide their household needs and send her children to school.

She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as noodles and canned goods, and to buy school supplies for her children. In the future, Lyra hopes to improve their house.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as noodles and canned goods, and to buy school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 27-year-old woman; she is married and has six sons and two daughters. Iman owns a farm, raising cattle and earning income by selling  dairy products. Iman wants to expand her farm by purchasing more cattle and fodder. Since she lacks the cash she took out a loan from FATEN to purchase them. 

Iman works hard on her dairy farm, and is assisted by her husband who is in the picture with her here.

loans.use: to buy fodder and more cattle

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 3 children. She has a retail shop that sells candies, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for one year. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods and more beverages to sell. Jocelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is a 38-year-old married man with 5 children. His eldest is 13 years old while the youngest is only 2 years old.

Sergio is a farmer who owns and tills land in Trinidad, Bohol. He grows rice crops and then sells his harvest to rice traders. He earns about 4,000 PHP (~$100) a month from farming. He works hard to increase his harvest and earnings. 

He has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies. Sergio is hopeful that this loan will help his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods and detergents. Judith is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and detergents.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with eight children, four girls and four boys. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of buying and selling goats. Her potential customers are neighbors and butcher operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business in the future.

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase six goats and pay for their transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase six goats and pay for their transport.

loans.name: Jorgita

texts.en:
Jorgita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, detergents and snacks. She has had this business for one year. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy beverages and canned goods. Jorgita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages and canned goods.

loans.name: Teogenes

texts.en:
Teogenes is 43 years old and is a married man with seven children. He earns a living through farming. He started growing rice 20 years ago. He said farming is very challenging. Sometimes it's the weather and sometimes it's the lack of finances that prevent him from having an abundant harvest. Despite all that, he still works hard to support his family.

Teogenes applied for a loan from CEVI. He plans to use it to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies. He hopes this loan will help increase his harvest and his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nukramo

texts.en:
Nukramo is an honest and hardworking woman. She is married and the mother of two children. Her husband works as a taxi driver in a local city. Nukramo sells woman’s fabrics at the market of “Korvon” in Dushanbe city. She has been selling fabrics for 13 years and she has broad experience in this business. Nukramo wishes to improve her living conditions and expand her business. She would like to get a loan of $1,900 for purchasing more women’s fabrics to sell.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy women’s fabrics.

loans.name: Dilshodi

texts.ru: Дилшод проживает в районе Бохтар. Ему 21 год. Он холост. У него среднее образование. Он живет вместе с родителями. Дилшод предоставляет услугу, такси. В основном он развозит людей по району. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже год. Кредит берет для приобретения новой легковой автомашины.
texts.en: Dilshod lives in the Bohtar district.  He is 21 years old and single.  He has a secondary education.  He lives together with his parents.  Dilshod provides a taxi service and primarily drives people within the district.  He has been involved in this business for one year.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a new passenger car.

loans.use: to purchase a new passenger vehicle

loans.name: Terfel

texts.en:
Terfel is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. Terfel has a retail shop that sells beverages, canned goods and snacks. He has had this business for one year. 

He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods and beverages. Terfel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with seven children, five girls and two boys. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a business of buying and selling cows. She faces the major challenge of fluctuations in price at the market. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase one cow and pay transport charges. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and pay transport charges.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks. Maricris is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Sharavdochin

texts.en:
Sharavdovchin, age 41, runs a public transportation business in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. After working for a public transportation company for twenty years, he decided to start a business by himself, using his own minivan. He has permission to carry passengers on one of the city’s remote bus lanes, which lacks bus services. 

Sharavdochin is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase necessary tools and parts to renovate his minivan. A portion of the loan is also going toward the development of his business. He says that he is working hard to be able to afford to buy another minivan, which would help develop his business to a great extent.  

His children – aged 8, 15, and 17 – attend public school, while his wife works in the book section of a department store. Recently, Sharavdovchin’s family moved into a small house which he built using his past savings. He aims to increase his family income by expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary parts and tools to renovate his minivan.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida, 48, is married and has one son and three daughters. Her husband is a farmer, he has some land planted with olive trees. 

Aida took out a $3,000 loan from FATEN to purchase baby olive trees for her husband to add to his olive grove to increase olive production. 

Aida's husband can't buy the trees now without a loan, as olives are a seasonal crop, and they are not in season right now, so he is short of cash. 

Aida is photographed in FATEN's branch in Jenin.

loans.use: to buy baby olive trees for her husband

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. For the past 5 years she has had a retail shop where she sells AVON products like cosmetics & clothing. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock from AVON.

Grace is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock from AVON to sell

loans.name: Tanzanite Group

texts.en:
Sylivia, who is in her mid-20s, is married with two children who go to school. She has had a grocery business for two years now.  She works from 10am to 11pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for replacing the missing items in her grocery.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Tanzanite", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To replace the missing items in the grocery.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a married woman with six children – one boy and five girls. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from her home to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the dry, hot season the availability of fish is minimal, making it difficult to meet her customers’ demands. 

With her KES 10,000 loan Mariamu wants to purchase bundles of dry fish for sale. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of dry fish for sale.

loans.name: Ma Ana

texts.en:
This is Ma Ana, 35, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a vendor, and mother of four children, all of whom are still in school. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way to college. Like Ma Ana, most Filipino parents believe that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Ma Ana is a broom maker. She buys materials to make the brooms and she sells them in the marketplace or to suppliers. She makes the brooms in the convenience of her home. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2200 in sales every day.

To help Ma Ana continue operating of her business, she is requesting a Php12, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy materials, like broomcorn, steel wire, and string. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma Ana dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials she needs in her business.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. For the past 3 years she has had a food shop where she serves dishes like afritada & caldereta. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for cooking.

Leonita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
This is Lida, 47, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She’s married to Jimmy, a factory worker. She’s a mother of three children who are still students. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses and save for the future of her grandchildren.

Lida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She is also a rice dealer. Lida earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece or by the kilo. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 240 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, rice and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lida hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products she needs for her business.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is a 52-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. Her husband is a fisherman.

Jovita and her husband run a fishing business. They own a fishing boat that her husband uses to catch fish. Jovita helps by selling his catch at the market. She also requested a loan to buy fishing hooks and gears to repair their fishing boat.

In the future, Jovita hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to buy fishing hooks and gears to repair their fishing boat

loans.name: Jossa Mae

texts.en:
Jossa Mae is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 2 children. For the past year, she has had a retail shop where she sells vegetables like carrots. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of vegetables.

Jossa Mae is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school (one is still too young). She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a retail business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments from those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of expanding into a wholesale shop in the future.

With her KES 5,000 loan, Lucy wants to purchase sacks of sugar, maize flour and paraffin. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, maize flour and paraffin.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. For the past 3 years he has had a junk shop where he buys & sells recycled plastics & bottles. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more recycled plastics & bottles.

Brian is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more recycled plastics & bottles.

loans.name: Gorett

texts.en:
Gorett lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her old parents. Gorett lives in a house that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food for the family.   

Gorett has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for five years, and she works six days out of every week. Gorett sells her products from home, by means of retail. 

Gorett has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. 

The main business challenges for Gorett include seasonality and thieves.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages for charcoal and also to buy her own plot of land so that she can build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Junezza

texts.en:
Junezza is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 1 child. 

Junezza has a retail shop that sells candies, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy candies, beverages and snacks.

Junezza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Junezza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy candies, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Solat

texts.en:
Solat and her husband live about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have six children: three sons and three daughters.
 
Solat and her husband raise bananas and flowers. In addition, she also sells Chinese noodles and coffee in front of her house when she is free from farming. 

She is applying for a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike to carry bananas and flowers to market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to carry bananas and flowers to market.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Ellen has a shop that sells fish such as sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy more fish to sell.

Ellen has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ellen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a single man, 27 years old, and a residence of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

He raises rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years.
 
Abel earns PHP 4,500 a month from this activity. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional rice variant seedlings, fertilizers and necessary farm pesticides in order to increase his production.

Abel has been a member of GDMPC for two years. He hopes to augment his production in the future and is plowing additional farm fields to work on. In so doing, he can obtain more income.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice variant seedlings, fertilizers and necessary farm pesticides.

loans.name: Chiboga

texts.en:
Chiboga is a single woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four months, she has operated a fish-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy season the availability of fish for sale is low. She dreams of purchasing a refrigerator to store fish for sale. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for sale.

loans.name: Phearun

texts.en:
Phearun is 36 years old and his wife, Chanleap, is 32 years old. They have been married since 1998 and have two daughters. One is in school and the other one is still young. 

The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phearun is a motor remoque taxi driver. (This is a motorbike pulling a trailer.) His wife is a garment worker.
  
Phearun is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase his neighboring land to expand his property.

loans.use: To purchase his neighboring land to expand his property.

loans.name: Ma.eileen

texts.en:
This is Ma. Eileen, 45, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Franzales, a vendor, and is the mother of their young children. 

Ma. Eileen operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like pineapples, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells coconuts, bananas and other Filipino fruit staples. Also in her product inventory are charcoal and rice, which add to her daily income. Her store is located in the market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,166 in sales every day.

She manages their own household while operating the business together with her husband. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of fruit, charcoal and rice to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Eileen dreams of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own house and lot in a prominent subdivision in a nice location. 

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional quantities of fruits and other products she sells in her business.

loans.name: Mazera

texts.en:
Mazera is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling maize flour, wheat flour and sugar at the market to her neighbors. She dreams of expanding her business to establish rental houses in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu because of favorable loaning procedures.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a 39-year-old married woman in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has two healthy school-aged children. 

Arlyn is operating a sari-sari (variety) store in their community as a source of living. She has enjoyed this buying and selling activity for two years already. 

Arlyn makes a monthly income of PHP 5,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase soft drinks, especially in demand this hot season. 

Arlyn has been a GDMPC member for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand the business and sell more soft drinks and similar items to elevate the usual income generated.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, especially in demand this hot season.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Fedelina has a shop that sells grown pigs. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan to buy animal feed for her pigs.

Fedelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Fedelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Chim (pictured here) sells dessert in her village, while her husband, Pheng, is a construction contractor. They have three children: two are in school and another one is still young.  The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chim is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to help with her husband’s business by purchasing construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto is a married man, 28 years old and humbly lives at Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He has one school-aged child. 

Loreto is a motorcycle driver. That is his means of living. He has been doing this for one year. He earns PHP 8,000 a month by doing this job.

Loreto has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 from GDMPC to buy durable tires, long-lasting motor spare parts and pay for repainting and remodeling. 

Loreto has been a member of GDMPC for two years. He hopes to add a sidecar to his single motorcycle for additional income.

loans.use: to buy durable tires, long-lasting motor spare parts and pay for repainting and remodeling.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala lives in village Akhalsopeli, East Georgia. She is 52 years old. Makvala is married and lives with her husband, Nikoloz. 

Makvala works as a chief cook at the local kindergarten. Along with her main job, she is actively involved in her family's agricultural business. They have three milk cows and get approximately 30 liters of milk per day. Part of the milk is used for yogurt production. Makvala sells yogurt and milk in Tbilisi grocery stores. The family also owns a plot of land where maize is grown. Almost all harvested corn is used in the dairy farm for feeding the cows. 

Makvala has requested credit for purchase of fertilizers for the cornfield. After fertilizing, the family expects a better harvest; part of the harvest will be sold at the local market, increasing the total income of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her cornfield

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel, age 41, is engaged in a farming production activity to support her family's needs. She has been involved in this kind of activity for three years and is grateful to be earning a monthly total of PHP 8,000.00 from her business. She and her husband live in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, and have three school-aged children living with them.

Richel has requested  a loan of PHP 25,000.00 from GDMPC to acquire necessary fertilizers and pesticides, pay weeding maintenance costs, and purchase rice seedlings. She has been a member of GDMPC for two years now. She anticipates a bountiful harvest and intends eventually to grow other crops to increase her income.

loans.use: to acquire necessary fertilizers and pesticides, pay weeding maintenance costs, and purchase rice seedlings

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
This is Irenea, 52, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Ignacio, a farmer, and a mother of three children, all of whom are married. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Irenea operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Irenea buys supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Aside from the variety store, she sells fruits, rice and processed meat products. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 425 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages, as well as processed meat products and rice to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Irenea hopes to be able to expand soon and to be in good health always. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her store.

loans.name: Mamba Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who go to school. She has had a charcoal business for one year now.  She works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her charcoal stock and pay school fees, other school expenses and household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.  Her dream is to one day be able to buy land.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mamba" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Dullateb

texts.en:
Dullateb (pictured in front of his wife’s grocery store) is 25 years old. His wife, Manrofiyah. is 25 years old. They have been married since 2008 and have two young children: one son and one daughter. They live along National Road Number 6, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Dullateb sells cows and oxen, while his wife runs a grocery store at home. He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase cattle and oxen for sale.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and oxen for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Grace has a shop that sells electronic loads used for mobile payments on the GLOBE & SMART networks. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy electronic loads for several networks.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy electronic loads for mobile payments on several networks

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, age 42, runs a sari-sari (general) store. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods and noodles.
  
She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell from her store. She and her husband have three children, two of whom are enrolled in school. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina's goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell from her store, such as snack foods and noodles

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 49-year-old woman, married and living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Living with her is her only child.

It is her passion to raise animals such as hogs and she is definitely enjoying the job. This is her source of income. She has been doing this for six years, which shows her endurance and that she is an animal lover. She earns PHP 6,000 a month from this work, not exactly enough for the needs of her family.

Lilia has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 from GDMPC to purchase hog feed for fattening and nourishing the hogs to grow quickly into firmly-bodied hogs and for the maintenance of the pig shelter. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She hopes to raise more hogs in the future and increase her usual monthly earnings.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and for the maintenance of a pig shelter

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida makes and sells crab nets. She is a hard-working entrepreneur and has been in this business for 20 years. She earns an additional income from ready-to-wear (second-hand) clothing sales. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to purchase bamboo for making crab nets as well as to buy ready-to-wear clothing to offer for sale.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo for making crab nets as well as to buy ready-to-wear clothing to offer for sale

loans.name: Rahmeh

texts.en:
Rahmeh is a 47-year-old hardworking mother. Rahmeh has a few goats around her house that she used to start a small diary business 20 years ago. During this time, she has increased the number of goats and started to make yogurt and cheese to sell. 

Now Rahmeh has applied for a loan so she can buy new equipment and open her own store to sell yogurt and cheese rather than selling at home.

loans.use: To open her own store to sell yogurt and cheese

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Betty provides motorela or habal-habal motorcycle transport services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the business.

Betty is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Betty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for utilities

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap (pictured above) is a silk weaver, a traditional Cambodian profession, while her husband is now a security guard. Sopheap hopes to continue her enterprise, and so is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase weaving materials.

The couple has two children, a son and a daughter, and the family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 43-year-old married woman with six school-aged children. 

She has a sari sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells various items like coffee, shampoo and diapers. 

Leonila works hard to help provide for her family's needs. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, detergent, soap and shampoo. 

Leonila hopes to expand her business in the future. She also hopes to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, detergent, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Zaldy

texts.en:
Zaldy is 44 years old and married with one child to care for. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past two years, Zaldy has been making his living as a motorcycle driver to help provide for his family’s daily needs. He earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

Zaldy is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through GDMPC to purchase tires and spare parts to keep his motorcycle in good running condition and continue his business. He has been a member of GDMPC for the past year. In the future, Zaldy hopes to increase his income with his remodeled and smooth-running motorcycle and service.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Hosnia

texts.en:
Hosnia is a 55-year-old woman who is married with two sons. One of her sons is a Palestinian National Authority employee. The other son works in a trade and both earns a decent income.

Hosnia wants to buy new home furniture and appliances such as a television, computer and new living room. Because of the decent salaries their sons earn, she wants to take a loan of $2,000 to pay in cash.

As Hosnia gets FATEN's loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she can purchase and pay in cash in an easy and fast way and improve her home and family life.

loans.use: To pay for new home furniture and appliances.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, age 40, runs a sari-sari (general) store in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She and her husband have three school-aged children who help her in managing the sari-sari store. This is the family's means of living. Evelyn has been doing this for two years now and is grateful to be earning a monthly total of PHP 10,000.00. 

Evelyn has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000.00 from GDMPC in order to purchase more products to sell from her shop, basic commodity items such as laundry soap, checheria, cereals, noodles, canned goods, and generic medicines. 

Evelyn has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She hopes to expand the business so as to increase her income from it.

loans.use: to buy basic commodity items, such as such as laundry soap, checheria, cereals, and noodles, to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Junjay

texts.en:
Junjay is a 24-year-old man who is married and residing in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is blessed with two school-aged dependents.  

Driving is the prime source of survival for his family.  Junjay has been running his transport business for two years.  It is tiresome work, yet enjoyable and so much fun. His family motivates him to keep going.  He earns PHP 4,000.00 a month from this work. 

Junjay has requested a loan amount of PHP 5,000.00 from GDMPC to purchase spare parts and to repaint his vehicle to attract more passengers.  He has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year.  He hopes to own another motorcycle and have it rented to earn additional daily income.

loans.use: purchase spare parts and repaint his vehicle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 57-year-old woman. She is separated and living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Living with her are the four school-aged children who have helped her in running the sari-sari (variety) store. It is basically the means of living for the family. She has been doing this activity for one fruitful year already. Elizabeth earns 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from this business. She decided to take a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional stock of canned goods, rice and sacks of rice bran to sell in the local community. She is getting one year of her membership with GDMPC. She hopes to expand the business and have an ample display of needed commodities to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of canned goods, rice and sacks of rice bran to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a business lady who runs a hair salon. She has been in the business for five years and has employed two people.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her finances by saving her money.
  
She hopes to own a big salon so as to serve more people. Her dream is to be a successful business lady. 

She has requested 20,000 KES to buy a hair blow drier and hair products.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow drier and hair products.

loans.name: Eak

texts.en:
Eak sells vegetables and fish. Her husband is a construction worker. They have been married since 1985 and have four children, one son and three daughters. They live along National Road Number 6, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Eak is asking for a loan of $300 for purchase more vegetables and fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fish for sale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married parent with ten children. She runs a clothing business in the Philippines and works hard to support her family. She earns additional income from raising pigs.  Helen has been sustaining her business activities with the help of her twelve past loans from NWTF. 

Helen is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more clothing to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a 43-year-old married woman who lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is blessed with four healthy, school-aged children. For the past two years, Chona has been running a business where she sells beauty and personal products in her local community. Her work helps provide for her family’s daily needs. Chona earns 8,000 PHP a month.

Chona is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase more beauty and personal products to sell, such as shampoo, lotion, makeup, and deodorant. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year, and helps her clients care for themselves. Chona is looking forward to expanding her business and creating a display space at her home.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty and personal products to sell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie, a single mother of two school-aged children, is 28 years old and living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. The operator of a retail sari-sari store business for three years now, she earns about PHP 5,000.00 a month.

A member of GDMPC for almost year, Elvie has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to buy additional liquor and soft drink stocks to sell in the local community. She hopes to expand her business and gain more profit in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional liquor and soft drink stocks to sell.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat is 32 years old and her husband, Ry, is 36 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. 

Yat sells second-hand clothes. She buys clothes from Phnom Penh markets and sells them in the local market. Her husband is a farmer and drives a motor taxi when he is free from farming. 

Yat is asking for a loan of $1,000 to assist in her husband’s farming business by buying a motorized hand tiller.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s farming business by buying a motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Mirazol

texts.en:
Mirazol is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Mirazol has a retail shop that sells bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more bananas and coconuts to sell.

Mirazol is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mirazol hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a 46-year-old woman who is married and settling down in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has two school-aged children living with her. Amalia engaged in a carenderia (food-selling business) at home and she displays delicious delicacies at her home. Amalia has been doing this work for two years and earns 7,000 PHP a month. 

Amalia is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through GDMPC to buy the ingredients needed to prepare her daily recipes. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. Amalia hopes to expand her business and provide more tasty dishes to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia, a 48-year-old widow residing in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, has four school-aged children. Together with her children, she has been operating a retail sari-sari store to make a living for two years now, earning PHP 8,000.00 a month.

A member of GDMPC for almost one year, Amalia has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to purchase additional commodities such as milk, soap, diapers and more to sell in the local community. She hopes to expand her business and gain more income in the future so as to provide the kind of life her children deserve.

loans.use: to purchase additional commodities including milk, soap, diapers, etc. to sell in the local community.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan is 47 years old and is married to Samoeun, also 47. They live in a village along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from city. They have been married since 1980 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. Two are garment workers and other two are construction workers. 

Yan is a construction worker. His wife stays at home and does housework. He hopes to start a new supplementary business driving a motor taxi so that he will be able to earn extra income. Hence he is asking for a loan of $700 to launch the business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to start his new motor taxi business.

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en:
Sifa lives in Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is in school. Sifa lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food for the family.   

Sifa has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week. 

Sifa sells her products at the market by means of retail.  

Sifa has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. The main business challenges for Sifa include seasonality and thieves.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes and also to buy her own plot of land so that she can build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children.
 
Jocelyn has a retail shop that sells bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional bananas and coconuts.

Jocelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas and coconuts.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 38 years old, married and has two children in school.  

He is able to provide for his family with the income he gets from his barber shop. He has been running the business for six years.  

In addition, he owns a green grocery which earns him extra income. He was previously selling second-hand clothes.

Paul hopes to open other outlets of his business for more income generation. He has requested 20,000 KES to expand his business premises and buy additional seats for his barber shop.

loans.use: To expand his business premises and buy additional seats for his barber shop.

loans.name: Mbalenhle Group

texts.en:
Tholakele is 41 years old and single with four children, age 17 to 26. 

For the last year and a half, she has been raising chickens and selling them from her home. 

She requested a loan from WDB and Kiva to purchase additional stock to increase the size of her chicken retail business.

Tholakele sees her business greatly expanding over the next five years. However, her business faces the problem of her customers taking her stock on credit and not repaying her on time. 

Despite this, Tholakele says that the loan she received from WDB has helped her life a lot. She would like to thank Kiva and WDB for helping poor women.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a 25-year-old woman who owns a coffee shop in the city of Jenin- Palestine. Fadwa wants to add different kinds of coffee to the menu of the coffee shop. Therefore, she took out a loan from FATEN to purchase an advanced coffee maker.

Fadwa's brother is a Palestinian National Authority employee and her father works in a chicken store. The three of them together take care of the household expenses.

Fadwa, who is photographed here, tries to attract more clients as competition in restaurants and coffee shops is high in Jenin.

loans.use: To purchase an advanced coffee maker.

loans.name: Vevian

texts.en: Vevian is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Vevian has a computer shop that provides encoding, printing and repair of computers. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools needed for the repair services. Vevian is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Vevian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools needed for the repair services

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Leonida has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks. Leonida is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Leonida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude lives in Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (3 orphans). Gertrude lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Gertrude has a business of tailoring. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. She sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Gertrude has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothes. She also generates additional income through a bridal jewelry shop and night parking garage. The main business challenges for Gertrude include seasonality and   thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal shop in Kampala city.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing materials

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Gina has a food shop where she sells snacks like rice & cassava cakes. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Gina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23 year old single man. He has been working as a barber for 8 years. He is well known in the region and liked by most of his customers.

Unlike most of his friends, who spent their childhood playing and enjoying every moment of it, Ahmad was only almost 15 years old when he started working. He is a hard worker. He develops his work every time he finds the suitable time to do so. 

Ahmad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy cosmetics requested by most of his customers. In addition, He will be paying off what's left from his new car purchase.
 
Ahmad hopes to expand his business more and more and to live up to his customers expectations.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for his business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
This is Rosa, 30, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Jacky, a driver, and mother to their children. With her husband, Rosa manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosa operates a small repacking business. She buys her products from wholesalers and repackages it in smaller quantities. The then sells it to stores in the community. Her products are garlic, black pepper, pandan leaves and other herbs and spices used in cooking. She also earns additional income in the operation of their tricycle. She has one tricycle, which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Rosa’s husband drives the tricycle. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community store. She earns a minimum of PHP950 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rosa is requesting a PHP12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy garlic, black pepper and other stocks for her repacking business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosa hopes to be able to expand soon to sustain their daily needs. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of herbs & spice products that she needs in her business.

loans.name: Masiphile Group

texts.en:
Nonhlanhle is 42 years old and single. She has 6 young children, 3 of whom attend school. She also cares for two family members who live with her in the town of Empangeni, South Africa. She has been running a retail business for the last year, selling fried dough, chips, ice cream, sandwich meat, and sweets to children at her local school. She also receives support from a grant issued by the South African government to help raise her children.

Nonhlanhle has requested a loan through WDB and Kiva to purchase more stock for her business. She has a lot of demand from the children at her local school, and her business has been growing very quickly. She would eventually like to open a proper store near the school to sell her products. She thinks that this loan will improve her life by increasing the profits she makes from her business. Nonhlanhle is a new client of WDB and Kiva and she is hoping for a better future. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase snacks and other foods for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Sarah  has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods & beverages.

Sarah is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Sarah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods & beverages.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en: Nulu  lives in  Uganda. She is single and has 6 children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (one orphan). Nulu's business is a drug shop.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out a week.. Nulu has requested a loan of 1200000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO  which she will use to buy more boxes of drugs and syrups. She also generates additional income through selling piped water and dry cleaning services.The main business challenge(s) for Nulu include defaulters and thieves.  Nulu lives in a home that she owns and she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of drugs and syrups

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is from the village of Manavi in the Kakheti Region. He is 49 years old and lives with his wife Maya and mother in law, who is retired. 

Amiran has some health problems and receives relevant social assistance from the government, but still he is actively involved in operations at the family owned dairy farm. Amiran and Maya own 3 milk cows. They sell yogurt, cheese and milk in their and nearby villages. They have loyal customers as their dairy products are well-known by good quality. The family has 30 years experience in dairy farming.

Amiran has  requested a loan to purchase  2 additional milk cows. The family will be able to sell approximately 60% more dairy products. This will have a positive impact on the family’s income. 

Amiran and Maya plan to reinvest the expected increase in income in further expansion of the dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase 2 milk cows for the dairy farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more stock like sugar, posho, soap and beans for resale

loans.name: Merlyna

texts.en:
Merlyna is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has 2 children. 

Merlyna has a shop where she sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more stock of used clothing.

Merlyna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlyna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
This is Esperanza, 46, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Rasty, who was previously a driver and construction worker, but he stopped working because he had a mild stroke.  Esperanza is also a mother of two children, both are still studying. Together, with her husband and children, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Esperanza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Esperanza earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells cold cuts and fish. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 278 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. A portion of the loan will be used for additional capital for her fish business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Esperanza hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to have an additional business like direct selling. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 47 year old married man. He has been working in construction for 20 years. Jamal is an honest man, a hard worker, and has a very good reputation in his area.

Jamal is an Al Majmoua-Kiva partner for the first time. He has requested a loan in order to buy extra materials and tools needed to build an extra room for a project he is working on. It's hard to save extra money these days, that's why Jamal finds requesting a loan to do unfinished business is a blessing.

Jamal hopes to expand his business more and more in the future to cover his family's expenses and to make sure all their needs are met in a very satisfactory way.

loans.use: to buy extra materials and tools to build a requested room.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is a 39 year old single mother with 3 children, aged 5-21 years old. She has a lame brother whom she looks after as well. She owns a house and stays with 3 people in Hioma, Uganda. Her dream is to educate her children up to university level. 

For 9 years, Robinah has been dealing in the bar business. She started by selling local gin and later bought crates of beer and soda. Robinah faces a challenge of high rate of defaulters. Nevertheless, her dream is to own a bar. Robinah needs the loan to buy beer, sodas and seats for the pub.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda and seats.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta, 54, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Arestarco, a businessman. Julieta is mother to four children, three of whom have their own families and one is now in college. By the grace of God, Julieta has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and to support her child’s schooling. A dream for most poor Filipino parents, like Julieta, is to send their children to college. They believe that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Julieta operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like pineapples, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells green and ripe mangoes, bananas, and other Filipino fruit staples. Aside from the fruits, she sells barley, which is a food supplement. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP512 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Julieta is requesting a PHP8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruit and barley to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Julieta would like her youngest son to graduate and get a stable job. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of fruits and barley that she needs in her business.

loans.name: Delilah

texts.en:
Delilah is 56 years old, married, and has four children. Delilah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Delilah has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming rice. Delilah aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Sarouen

texts.en:
Sarouen is 59 year old and is a grocery seller.  Her husband is a farmer and their income is $13 per day.  They have no children to stay with.  Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $5 on electricity and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy more grocery goods to sell.  She started doing this career almost ten year ago, just selling some cake and other goods and she has made it more and more successful.  Now she can have a lot of goods to sell in front of her house.  In the future, she plans to enlarge her career to sell more goods so that she can serve her costumers well.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (4 relatives).

Hadjah has a business of rearing chickens.  She has been in this business for a few months and she works 7 days out of every week.  Hadjah sells her products from home, by means of retail.  Hadjah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more chicken feed and chicks.  

She also generates additional income through rental rooms.  The main business challenges for Hadjah include ever increasing prices of chicken feed and   thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and to also build more rental rooms. Hadjah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of  chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is from the village of Patara Lilo, East Georgia.  He is 33 years old, married and lives with his wife Tamar and mother Katia.  She is retired.

The main source of income for the family is agriculture, where all family members are involved.  In particular, they own 3 milk cows and produce yogurt. Produced yogurt is sold in Tbilisi by Katia and Guram.  Guram has 15 years experience in dairy farming. 

Guram requested a loan to purchase a plot of land which is located in his village.  He will use it for agriculture, for growing various fruits and vegetables and to sell it locally. 

Guram plans to use the increase in income to improve his family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land

loans.name: Sukhav

texts.en:
Sukhav is a chicken seller.  Her husband is a farmer and their income is $13 per day.  They have 3 children, two are studying in school.  Every month, she has to spend $52 on food, $6 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $13 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy chicken food for feeding chickens to sell.  Before she only fed a few chickens at home.  After she learned how to feed chickens well, she started to feed more and it is going well.  She wants to continue feeding more and more to get eggs and chickens to sell. When she gets more income, she plans to repair her house and send her children to study at least to finish high school.

loans.use: To buy chicken food for feeding chickens to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hard working 53 year old business man.  He is married and blessed with 5 children aged: 28, 25, 23, 20, and 16 years old.  For the last 8 years, to provide for his family he has been doing welding.  He supplements his income by renting out his rental houses. 

Previously he was a salaried employee.  He wants in the next 5 years to expand his welding business and his dream is to venture into the farming business.  He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy grinders and welding materials.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has been able to learn business management skills that he employs to properly run his business.

loans.use: to buy grinders and welding materials

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylvia is a 29 year-old single mother of 3 children between 4 months and 8 years old.  She lives in a rented house in Hioma, Uganda.  For four years she has been in the bar business.  She started with 1,800,000 shillings and she currently has working capital of four million shillings.  Sylvia faces the challenge of price fluctuations and stiff competition.  Nonetheless, she dreams of setting up a hotel. Sylvia needs the loan to buy beer to sell in her bar.

loans.use: To buy beer for the bar

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Met, 54 years old, sells cakes.  Her income is $4 per day. She is a single mother with 5 children, two of whom are studying.  The other three are workers earning $9 per day.  Every month Met has to spend $66 on food, $7.5 on electricity, $26 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $14 on other expenses.  She sells many kinds of cake to offer her customers and can sell alot of cake because her cakes taste good. She expects to send the rest of her children to study at the university so that they can find good jobs. 

She would like a loan of $800 to buy a plot of land for planting.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for planting.

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en: Apollo is a 48 year-old married man with 5 children between 8 and 28 years old.  He also has two dependents, and he lives with 6 people in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. For 4 years Apollo has been in the produce business which he has developed.  He has managed to buy a plot of land and build a house. Apollo faces the challenge of limited capital to buy enough cereals to meet the increasing demand of his customers.  His dream is to own a food store. Apollo needs a loan to buy rice, tobacco, and beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice, tobacco, and beans to sell

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school.  Eseza has a cosmetics shop . She has been in this business for over 8 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Eseza has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

The main business challenge for Eseza includes ever-increasing prices of cream relaxers and braids. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon and also build more rental rooms.  Eseza owns her home, which has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Huch

texts.en: Huch, 35 years old, farms and plants vegetables with her husband.  Their income is $14 per day. She has six children, two of whom are working in a factory and the rest of whom help her doing farming. Every month, she has to spend $83 on food, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to hire the workers to clear the grass on the plantation so that her vegetables can grow well. She wants to plant more kinds of vegetables to sell so that she can bring more income to the family and be able to support her children's studies until they finish university.

loans.use: To hire worker to clear the grass in her plantation

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 56 years old, married, and has nine children, one of whom is in school. Nida is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. Nida requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Nida has been farming vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Isaïe

texts.fr: Isaïe  est un éleveur, il est client d’ACB depuis 2010. Il est célibataire, il est  âgé de 28 ans. Il est né au  Rwanda.son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de l’université en gestion(A1). C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser le prêt pour acheter  les aliments des poules (20 sacs de des aliments des poules) et payer  la main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire  est abaisser les prix des œufs pour attire la clientèle et augmenter la capacité de son poulaille en vue de satisfaire les marchés. Dans l’avenir il voudrait être le grand distributeur des œufs et de la chair des poules, il voudrait bientôt fonder le foyer.
texts.en:
Isaïe, age 28, is unmarried and a chicken farmer. He's been a client of Kiva's partner, ACB, since 2010. He was born in Rwanda and attended a business management university for four years.
