texts.es: Julio Alberto, tiene la edad de 46 años, está casada, vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno apto y en buenas condiciones para la explotación de café, el terreno está sembrado y en producción años atrás. El quiere darle a su cafetal una ayuda con el  abono y limpiarlo de las plagas para así este año tener mayores producciones de café, generando así ganancias para su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Julio Alberto is 46-years-old, married, and lives with his wife and three children who are his top priority.  He plans to use the loan to purchase agricultural additives for his coffee plantation.  He has a land parcel that is ready and in good condition for growing coffee.  He has seeded the land and it has been used for coffee production in past years.  He would like to help the land produce with fertilizer and remove pests so that it can produce more coffee which will lead to greater profits for his family’s well-being.  This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  They have given him this loan with greater ease and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to grow coffee.

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Mamudu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. He is 27 years old and was born in Kenema, in northern Sierra Leone. Mamudu is single with no children. He has been a businessman for many years now, selling top-up cards for all four mobile-phone networks. 

With the help of this loan, Mamudu and his group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. Mamudu will use his share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leone leones) to buy a large quantity of top-up (phone-use) cards to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of top-up cards to add to his business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has four children. She has received a senior-high education. Ekua prepares kenkey (a dish made from fermented maize) in Abura, which she has done for 20 years. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Ekua will use the loan to purchase bags of maize to make kenkey for resale. Ekua plans to plow the new profits from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to make kenkey (a dish made from fermented maize) for resale.

loans.name: Sacsayhuaman Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “SACSAYHUAMAN”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hayde; la socia tiene 49 años; la socia es soltero y tiene 3 hijos, de 25, 24 y 19 años de edad;  La socia se dedica a la elaboración de comidas caseras, la socia tiene un stand en el mercado San Blas en la misma ciudad de Cusco, la socia desea el crédito para comprar víveres y poder comprar los ingredientes al por mayor como aceite, arroz y papa, que es lo básico para elaborar la mayoría de los platos, también comprara fideos entre otros ingredientes. La socia comenta que ella aún apoya a la menor de sus hijas que está estudiando en el instituto la carrera profesional de Contabilidad; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir  en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los diferentes platos.
Las socias Alejandrina, Elba, Evelyn, Felicitas; estan en ese orden en la parte superior de la foto grupal, las socias tenian permiso de retirarse antes y dos de ellas llegaron despues.

Los socios desesan invertir el prestamo en la compra de instrumentos musicales, artesanía, implementar la imprenta. 

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank SACSAYHUAMAN.  This bank is in the Huanchac district of the Cusco province and department.

The member is Hayde and she is 49-years-old, single, and has three children who are 25, 24, and 19-years-old.  She works preparing home-cooked meals.  She has a stand in the San Blas market in Cusco.  She would like to use to loan to buy food and to be able to buy ingredients at wholesale prices such as: oil, rice, and potatoes which are the basic ingredients used to make the majority of the dishes she prepares.  She will also buy noodles, among other ingredients.  She comments that she still supports her youngest daughter who is studying the professional career of accounting in an educational institution.  She is requesting the loan to invest in ingredients used to prepare the different dishes.

The members Alejandrina, Elba, Evelyn, and Felicitas are in this order in the upper part of the group photo.  The members have permission to leave early and two also arrived later.

The members would like to invest the loan in musical instruments, artisan products, and printing.

She is very satisfied with and thankful for the support that they have offered her through this medium and she promises to follow through with the payment of her debt in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing different dishes.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
In the picture, Efua is showing three pans that contain plastic bowls, hair creams, ladies slippers and spoons in Abura. 

She is married and has three children. She has been in this retail business for six years. Her husband is a painter. Efua assists her spouse with paying utility bills and other household expenditures. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase more of the above-mentioned items for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua wishes to build a shop for the products.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls, hair creams, ladies slippers and spoons for resale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: In the photograph, Esi is showing the corn dough she uses to prepare the kenkey she sells. She is married and stays with her three children. Her husband is a farmer. Esi uses her income to support her partner in feeding and clothing her family. Esi will use the loan to purchase maize to expand her kenkey business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to reinvest for further growth of the business.

loans.use: to purchase maize to make kenkey

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 46 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en un su propia casa junto a su pareja Cadeon de 53 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los productos que con tanta voluntad y entrega han logrado cultivar Paulina y su esposo, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao y café, dependerá la calidad de frutos que obtenga.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes y frondosos, lleva 23 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es transportar sus productos hasta la ciudad de Sivia, lugar donde recibe mejores precios por sus granos de café y cacao. Paulina solicita el crédito para contratar jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en el mantenimiento respectivo de sus plantas como en la poda y el deshierbo de maleza. En adelante, espera sembrar más plantas de cacao y barbasco ya que cuenta con espacios sin cultivar. Este será su 12avo préstamo con MFP y se siente feliz por contar con el apoyo de todos ustedes ya que gracias a su apoyo esta prosperando. En esta oportunidad también espera beneficiarse con el crédito por lo cual ella esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en desmonte y cosechas de sus productos.
texts.en:
Paulina is 46 years old.  She is a very hard working woman who lives in her own house with her spouse, Cadeon, 53, and their three beloved children who are the motivating force behind all her efforts.  The products that she and her husband have managed to produce with so much effort and dedication have helped her much to progress in life.  

Every morning she starts off tending to her fields because she knows that the care she gives her cocoa bean and coffee plants determines the quality of fruit she’ll obtain.  What she most likes about her work is caring for the plants and she feels very happy when she sees them big and lush.  She’s been in this line of work for 23 years and the most difficult part is having to transport her products all the way to the city of Sivia which is where she gets the best prices for her coffee and cocoa beans.

Paulina is asking for a loan to hire day laborers to help her with the respective crops to do such chores as weeding and pruning.  In future, she’d like to plant more cocoa bean and barbasco (an evergreen bush) plants because she has uncultivated fields.

This will be her 12th loan with MFP and she feels happy to have support from all of you because thanks to it she’s making progress.  On this occasion she’s hoping once again to be the beneficiary of a loan and she is ready to make her installment payments punctually.  She will use the requested 2500 new soles to hire day laborers to help her pick and harvest her crops.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemi tiene 27 años de edad y tiene un hijo, ella nació en el distrito de Echarate (La Convección, Cusco, Perú) y  vive en la misma ciudad de Echarate a una hora de la ciudad de Quillabamba (La Convección, Cusco). Es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que junto con su pareja se dedica a la venta de materiales y herramientas de construcción. Ella atienda la ferretería desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días. Ya es un año que funciona el negocio y le está yendo muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales que le están haciendo falta como pinturas, clavos y otras cosas más. Su sueño de Noemi es estudiar la carrera profesional de administración  de empresas y expandir el negocio hacia la ciudad de Quillabamba. (Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.)
texts.en:
Noemí is 27 years old and has a son.  She was born in Echarate District (La Convección, Cusco, Perú) and still lives in the city of Echarate an hour from the city of Quillabamba (La Convección, Cusco).  She is an enterprising, hard working woman who together with her spouse sells building materials and tools.  She tends to the hardware store from 7am until 8pm every day.  The business has been operating for a year now and it’s doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy materials she needs like paint, nails and some other things.  Noemí’s dream is to study Business Administration and to expand the business to the city of Quillabamba.  (Quillabamba is the capital city of La Convección Province and an important commercial hub of the Lares and La Convección valleys.  The main activities are coca leaf, coffee, cocoa bean and fruit production.)

loans.use: to buy building materials and tools.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is into kenkey production. She is married and has six dependents. She has been in this trade for six years. Her husband is a farmer. 

Esi uses the income she earns from her sales to support her spouse in the payment of utility bills.   She will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize to prepare kenkey to sell to her customers. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit back into her business.

loans.use: buy maize to make kenkey for sale

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La señora  Irene, vive en un Barrio Trinidad, ella es casada y no tiene  hijos.

     Ella se dedica  a la compra y venta de quesos, en donde lleva dos años practicando esta actividad y comenta que deseque inicio con ello el va bien  ya que ha tenido un buen ingresos en su actividad y con ello a estado logrando solventar algunos gastos en su hogar.

    Lo que lo motivo fue su esposo para que juntos  trabajen y así tengan como  solventar sus gatos con las ganancias que vayan obteniendo  y así mismo también comprar más mercancía.

      Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda tener un mejor ingresos y con ellos poder seguir trabajando y para tener sus propios ahorros  para lograr.
texts.en: Irene lives in the Trinidad neighborhood.  She’s married and has no children.  She buys cheese to resell.  She’s been in this line of work for two years and comments that she’s done well with it since she started because earnings have been good and she’s been able to meet some household expenses with them.  Her husband motivated her so that they could work together and be able to cover expenses with the profits they’d earn as well as buy more merchandise.  What she wants most is to earn better income through this small activity to be able to continue to work and manage to have savings of her own.

loans.use: to pay for cheeses to resell.

loans.name: Mery De Jesus

texts.es:
Mery D. Jesús desD. hace un año compra una tienda donD. trabaja con su hijo mayor, ella con su negocio quiere mejorar su calidad D. vida y sus ingresos económicos.

Su esposo ya no trabaja debido a sus problemas D. salud, por esto Mery es quien hoy sostiene su hogar con la tienda.

Ella quiere mejorar el surtido ya que su negocios ha sido muy acogido en el barrio, además así pueD. tener mejores ingresos para apoyar a su esposo en la salud D. él.
texts.en:
Mery D. Jesús bought a store a year ago, where she works with her oldest son.  Through her business she wants to improve her income and quality of life.

Her husband has health problems and is no longer able to work, so it’s she who supports the household through her store.

She wants to improve her selection, now that business has been welcomed in the neighborhood.  This will also allow her to have a better income and be able to help her husband with his health issues.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama makes cassava powder (as shown in the picture) in Efutu-Mampong near Abura in Cape Coast.  Cassava powder is used in the preparation of a local dish called “kokontey”.   She has been in this business for 8 years.  She also sells charcoal.    

Ama is single and has 6 children. She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy cassava to process into powder to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a house.

loans.use: buy cassava to process into powder to sell

loans.name: Padawounam

texts.fr:
Padawounam est âgée de 45ans. Elle est mariée à un cultivateur.

Elle travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006 ; elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale. Il s’approvisionne à Lomé puis revend dans son quartier à Agoé Démakpoé.

Elle a requis son troisième crédit à WAGES afin de mieux s’approvisionner et répondre parfaitement à la demande.
texts.en: Padawounam is 45 years old. She is married to a farmer. Since 2006 she has been selling basic food items. She stocks up in Lomé and then resells in her neighborhood of Agoé Démakpoé. She is requesting her third loan from WAGES in order to improve her stock and meet the customer demand perfectly.

loans.use: to buy basic food items

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila, vive en un lugar muy bonito, ya que es muy fresco y todo tipo de frutas seda , en ese lugar, ella es casada con el señor Jesús, con quien procreo tres hijos quienes ya están casados. 

  Ella es ama de casa  y se dedica a la  compra y venta de maíz para tostarlo  y luego  venderlo en la misma localidad, en esta actividad lleva un año  y comenta que le bien ya que con ello  ha tenido un buen ingreso.

   Su inspiración por esta actividad inicio por su propia creatividad, para tener sus propios ingresos, para que se pueda apoyar con algunos gastos que se generan en su hogar.

      Lo que más deseo que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo que le han otorgado pueda mejorar su calidad de vida para así salir delante.
texts.en:
Lucila lives in a very beautiful place where it is very cool and there are all types of silk fruits. She is married to Jesús; they have three children who are all now married.  She is a housewife who buys corn to roast and then resell in the same community.  She’s been in this line of work for a year and comments that she’s done well with it because she’s had good earnings.
Her inspiration for this activity was her own creativity, to have income of her own and to help out with some of the household expenses.  What she most wants from this small activity and the loan she’s been granted is to be able to improve her quality of life to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to pay to have the corn roasted and then sell it ground.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married and has 8 children. She makes kenkey to sell at Abura.  In the picture, she is showing the soaked corn to be washed and milled into dough for the kenkey.

Ekua's husband is a driver.  She uses her income to assist him in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use this loan to purchase more corn to prepare kenkey to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further educate her children.

loans.use: buy more corn to prepare kenkey for sale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi sells provisions such as canned tomatoes, matches, toffees, Milo and other items at Abura. She is married and has 20 dependents. Her husband is a chain saw operator. 

Esi has been selling provisions for 8 years now. She supports her spouse in the payment of utility bills and other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana sells provisions, ceramic and plastic bowls, ladies slippers and other items at Abura. Nana has a junior high educational background. She is married to a teacher and together they live with their two children. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy ladies slippers and ceramic and plastic bowls to sell. She wishes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy ladies slippers, and ceramic and plastic bowls to sell.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga, tiene la edad de 49 años, está casada, vive con su hijo y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para la siembra de su café. Ella quiere mejorar la plantación de su cafetal y repoblar la parte más escasa de café. Ella quiere con este obtener de su cafetal mejores producciones y así generar mayores ganancias para su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Dominga is 49-years-old.  She is married and lives with her son and her husband who are her top priority.  She plans to use the loan to buy agricultural additives for growing coffee.  She wants to improve her coffee plantation and replant the part that has fewer coffee plants.  She wants to do this to obtain better production from her coffee plantation and thus generate greater profits for her family’s well-being.  This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She hasn’t taken out any earlier loans with state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with great ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow coffee.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba sells kenkey at Abura. She is in this picture showing the maize she uses for the kenkey. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a teacher. Araba has been selling kenkey for three years. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be added to her capital to buy more bags of corn to make the kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: Her loan will be added to her capital to buy more bags of corn to make the kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Remigia

texts.es:
La sociaLa socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “ROSALES D. SAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito D. Saylla, Provincia D. Cusco, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Remigia; la socia tiene 49 años; la socia es soltera;  La socia tiene 4 hijas D. las cuales dos D. ellas son independientes y y aún apoya a las otras dos; la socia desea que sus hijas prosperen y ayudarlas en sus estudios, una D. ellas viajo a Estados Unidos por unos meses, la socia tiene una chicharronería restaurante ubicado en el distrito D. Saylla, la socia venD. ricos chicharrones, trucha frita con papas doradas, caldos D. gallina, chayro, entre otros platos; la socia desea invertir el prestamo en esta ocasión en la chicharronería, la socia está ampliando el baño público y desea invertir en la compra D. materiales, para ampliar el baño y accesorios para el mismo, la socia también invertira una parte en la compra D. carne D. cerdo y D. papas por arroba. La socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra D. carne, papas y comprar accesorios para la implementación del baño público D. sus restaurante chicharronería.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Remigia, 49, is a member of the “Rosales D. Saylla” communal bank which belongs to Saylla District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is single and has four children, two of them independent and two still dependent.  She wants her children to progress and she wants to help with their schooling.  One of them traveled to the United States for a few months. 

Remigia has a ‘chicharronería,’ a restaurant in Saylla district where she sells delicious fried pork, fried trout with fried potatoes, chicken soup, and ‘chairo’ (traditional soup from Peruvian highlands), among other dishes.  She wants to invest the loan in the chicharronería.  She is expanding the public rest room and wants to buy materials to enlarge the bathroom and furnishings for it.  She will also use part of the loan to buy pork and potatoes by the sacksful.  She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of meat, potatoes and to buy furnishings  for the chicharronería restaurant’s public bathroom.

She is very satisfied and grateful for the support provided and commits to repay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the restaurant.

loans.name: María Leticia

texts.es:
María Leticia es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace algunos años motivada por mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y con el propósito de contribuir a cubrir los gastos del hogar empezó a vender mercancía desde su casa, inicialmente empezó con productos por catálogo y poco a poco ha empezado a ofrecer otros productos a sus clientes. 

En el futuro, María Leticia espera tener un gran negocio en el que además genere empleo. 

Actualmente esta emprendedora oriunda del municipio de La Unión al oriente de Antioquia, necesita de un préstamo para comprar mayor variedad de mercancía como cosméticos, accesorios de plata, entre otros, así logrará incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María Leticia is an enterprising woman who for many years has been motivated to seek a better quality of life for herself and for her family.  She also wants to contribute toward the household expenses, so she began selling merchandise from her home.  She started out doing catalog sales and little by little began offering products to her customers.

In the future María Leticia hopes to have a grand business and be able to create jobs.  She currently lives in La Union, to the east of Antioquia.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy a greater variety of merchandise, such as cosmetics, and silver accessories, among other things.  This way she can increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Piedras De Oro Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Cristina es soltera, tiene 23 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, se dedica a los oficios domésticos como también al comercio a la reventa D. ropa típica, inicio con un poco D. capital que tenia ahorrado, y hasta el momento lleva 5 años D. experiencia.

DeciD. organizar un grupo con el fin D. solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital D. trabajo, para la compra D. ropa típica: cortes, güipiles, suéteres, fajas, para revenderlos, ya que  quiere ver su negocio mejor y surtido. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas como: el comercio y la producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina is single and 23-years-old.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She spends her time working at domestic chores as well as reselling traditional clothing, a business she started with a small amount of capital she had saved.  Up to this point she has five years of experience.  

She decided to organize a group with the goal of requesting a loan that would enable her to expand her working capital for buying traditional clothing: cortes (skirts), güipiles (highly decorated long shifts worn over the corte), sweaters, and fajas (woven belts) to resell them as she would like to see her business better stocked.  The other members of the group work in various areas such as business and agricultural production.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing for resale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba smokes a variety of fish at Abura for resale. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Aba has been selling smoked fish for five years. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke to expand her business. She hopes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Femme commercante agee de 44 ans, mariee et mere de 6 enfants dont l'age varie entre 10 et 28 ans.
N'ayant pas d'appui considerable pour la poursuite de ses etudes secondaires, elle se lance dans la vente en detail des vivres frais.
Avec ses recettes qui s'elevent en moyenne a 60000 frs par jour.
le credit octroye renforcera le stock des cartons de poulet et de viande de boeuf afin de retablir l'equilibre entre l'offre et la demande.
Elle envisage beaucoup epargner afin de realiser sa vision qui n'est autre que l'installation d'une chambre froide.
Tres entreprenante , elle fait face aux droits de ses enfants et entreprend des relations de bon voisinage dans le quartier.
texts.en:
This woman, a merchant, is 44 years old, married, and has six children whose ages range from 10 to 28.
Not having had enough support to pursue her secondary studies, she began selling fresh food at retail.
She raises an average income of 60,000 Frs per day.
This loan will serve to strengthen her stock of boxes of chicken and beef in order to re-establish the balance between supply and demand.
She intends to save a large amount in order to realize her vision of installing a refrigeration room.
A very enterprising woman, she provides for her children and has set up good relations in her neighbourhood.

loans.use: To buy boxes of chicken thighs, boxes of pork sides, chicken wings, beef tail, and tripe.

loans.name: Hindira

texts.en: Hindira is 31 years old and lives with her partner. She has two children who are 8 and 13 years old. She has a small bakery in which she sells pastries, cakes, and specialties such as arroz con leche. With the loan, Hindira plans to purchase more ingredients for making her baked goods such as flour, sugar, and butter. Additionally, she plans to invest in a new sign for her bakery as her current one is very old. Hindira is passionate about her business and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baked goods

loans.name: Gloria Stella

texts.es:
Gloria siempre ha trabajado confeccionando a terceros, de esta manera ha podido hacer dinero para conformar su familia y tener una buena calidad de vida, sin embargo hace un tiempo le ofrecen comenzar a vender mercancía y productos por catálogo y se dio cuenta que era una excelente fuente de ingreso.

Ella no ha dejado de confeccionar, pero ella quiere continuar vendiendo mercancía por esto quiere comprar una mayor cantidad para tener una gran variedad de ella y así puede incrementar el número de clientes y de dinero.

Su sueño es tener un almacén con buen surtido para mejorar su calidad de vida y además poder generarle empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Gloria is always working; making things for others.  In this way she’s been able to make money to support her family and have a good quality of life.  However, some time ago she was offered the opportunity to begin selling merchandise through a catalog and she found this to be an excellent source of income.

She has not given up manufacturing, but wants to continue selling merchandise and wants to buy items in bulk so that she will have a good variety on hand and so that she will be able to increase the number of customers she has, as well as her income.

Her dream is to have a well stocked shop to be able to increase her quality of life and also create jobs for others.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua prepares and sells a meal known as "kenkey" at the Abura market. To prepare her kenkey, she buys maize from the market and soaks it in water to soften the maize for three days. On the third day, she washes the maize and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn and leaves it for a day. She divides the risen dough into two parts and mixes one part with water to get it into a porridge-like consistency form, which she cooks until it is firm but not fully cooked. She later mixes the rest of the uncooked dough in with the half-cooked dough. She molds the dough into balls and wraps them in corn husk. She then cooks these till they become soft enough to eat.

Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces, such as pepper sauce. It is often served with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, or roasted turkey.

Ekua has received a junior high school education. She is unmarried and has five children. She has been preparing and selling kenkey for three years and is responsible about seeing to the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more maize with which to prepare kenkey to sell. She intends to use the new profits from her business to provide for a meaningful eduation for her children.

loans.use: to buy more maize with which to prepare kenkey to offer for sale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has 4 children.  She sells maize, rice and other items at Abura, which she has done for some time now.  Her husband is a teacher.  Esi uses her income to assist her partner in the general upkeep of their home.   She will use this loan to purchase more of the above mentioned goods to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to save towards building a shop.

loans.use: buy food items to resell

loans.name: Mana Mawusse

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale et de mèches, Mana sollicite ce premier crédit pour renforcer son activité (elle exerce l'activité il ya 2ans). Elle a 25ans, célibataire. Elle a commencé en 2009 et achète à Lomé.
texts.en: A retailer of general food products and hair extensions, Mana is seeking her first loan to strengthen her business (which she has run for 2 years). She is 25 years old and unmarried. She began this business in 2009 and gets her supplies in Lomé.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, ella nació en el distrito de Echarate (La Convección, Cusco, Perú) y  vive en la comunidad de Papel Pata a 45 minutos de la  ciudad de Quillabamba (La Convección, Cusco). Es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que hace mucho tiempo se separo de su pareja. Ella a pesar de las adversidades sigue sacando a su familia, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos y gallinas, ella también se dedica al cultivo de frutas como por ejemplo naranjas, mangos, piñas, mandarinas, etc. Ya son varios años que funciona el negocio y le está yendo muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar chanchos. 

(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.)
texts.en:
Victoria, 48, is married and has four children.  She was born in Echarate District (La Convección, Cusco, Perú) and lives in the community of Papel Pata 45 minutes from the city of Quillabamba (La Convección, Cusco).  She is an enterprising, hard working woman who separated from her spouse some time ago.  Despite adversities she continues to move her family forward.

She raises small farm animals like pigs and chickens.  She also farms fruit like oranges, mangoes, pineapples, mandarins, etc.  The business has been in operation for several years now and she’s doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy pigs.

(Quillabamba is the capital city of La Convección Province and an important commercial hub of Lares and La Convección Valleys.  Its main activities are coca leaf, coffee, cocoa bean and fruit production.)

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba prepares banku and fish to sell in Abura. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Araba has been selling banku and fish for 3 years. She responsibly assists her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish and ingredients to prepare banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: buy more fish and ingredients to make banku

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es: Blanca Flor, tiene la edad de 50 años, está en unión libre, vive con su conyugue y su hijastro. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para la siembra de su café. Ella cuanta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo y tiene el terreno ya sembrado por lo cual lo que le hará es darle una pequeña  abonada para su buena producción este próximo año. Ella quiere logra de esta próximas cosecha mejores ganancias para el bienestar de su familia y seguir adelante con sus proyectos de vida. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Blanca Flor is 50-years-old and lives in a common-law marriage with her partner and stepson.  She plans to use the loan to purchase agricultural additives for growing coffee.  She has a piece of land that is appropriate for growing coffee and it is already planted.  What this will do is fertilize it a little for good production in the coming year.  She would like to have better profits in the next harvests for the well-being of her family and to get ahead with the projects in her life.  This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She hasn’t received other loans from state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her this loan with ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow coffee.

loans.name: Nelly Lucia

texts.es:
Desde hace muchos años Nelly ha trabajado las confecciones  en línea propia, su negocio actualmente tiene muy buen reconocimiento y las prendas que vende son de muy buena calidad.

Ella quiere siempre tener muy buen surtido para sus clientes, para así poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Nelly se sueña con un taller mas grande donde tenga varias máquinas y pueda generar empleo a madres cabeza de familia, mientras llega su sueño por lo menos necesita que sus ventas se incrementen.
texts.en:
Nelly has been working at sewing her own line of clothing and her business is now very well known.  The clothing she makes is of very good quality.

She always wants to have a good selection for her customers and in this way be able to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

Nelly dreams of having a bigger workshop where she will have several machines and be able to create jobs for single mothers.  While she is working on reaching her goal, she at least needs to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel de Jesús, es soltero y vive en un lugar muy bonito en donde las personas se dedican a bordar mantas.

   El solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en  la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de pan, en donde lleva  tres años y cuatro meses y comenta que le va bien ya que su  mama la apoya en la entrega de  los panes y también en la elaboración.

    El  se motivo a esta actividad ya  que salió  en busca de trabajo a san Cristóbal de la casas y encontró en una panadería y le gusto este tipo de trabajo y decidió practicarlo y tener su propio negocio en su comunidad y le ha dado buen resultado.

    Lo que más desea es que con el tiempo pueda tener más grande su panadería para que con el tiempo pueda ser  distribuidor de  las tienda en tragando panes y así  también apoyar a otras personas daño les empleo para que se ayuden entre sí.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesus is single and lives in a very pretty place where many people make a living embroidering blankets.  

He is applying for a loan so that he can buy ingredients for making bread.  He's operated the business for three years and four months.  He says that he's been successful because his mother helps make and deliver the bread.

He got the idea for the business after looking for a job in San Cristobal de Las Casas.  He met a baker there and liked the work, so he decided to start a bakery in his own town.  So far, so good.

He wants to develop the business and become a distributor to stores that sell bread.  He also wants to provide jobs to other people so that they can help one another.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his bakery business.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en: Hilaria works as a mechanic and has her own auto repair business. She is 43 years old and lives with her partner. She has four children, all of whom have moved out of the house. Hilaria is asking for a loan in order to purchase car parts, specifically metal plates and mirrors, in order to repair vehicles that are brought to her repair shop. She is very motivated to improve her business and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy car parts for her auto repair business.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea tiene 50 años de edad, ella es casada con el señor Juan y con quien procreo seis  hijos cinco ya están fuera de su responsabilidad y uno aún está con ellos Esteban de dieciseis años de edad.

    Ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de mantas para después bordarlas, con esta actividad lleva treinta y tres años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido sus propios ingresos para sostener  en bien a su familia.

      Lo que motivo a esta actividad fue su propio gusto ya que en la localidad donde ella vive las personas se dedican a bordar mantas lo que es la tradición ahí, ella desde muy pequeña se dedica a ello y esta muy contenta porque con ello a sacado a delante a  pequeña familia.

    Lo que más desea es  seguir trabajando con su actividad hasta que dios le preste vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Andrea, 50, and her husband, Juan, have six children, four of whom are grown and independent.  Their youngest child, Esteban is sixteen years old.  

Andrea will use her loan to buy supplies for her embroidery business.  She has operated the business for thirty-three years and says that she is pleased with it because it provides her with an independent income that she has used for the good of her family.

Andrea was well suited to an embroidery busienss because there's a long tradition of embroidering textiles in this part of Mexico.  She's embroidered textiles since she was a young girl and she's pleased she can make a living from it because she can help support her little family.  

What she most wants is to be able to continue her work for the rest of her life.

loans.use: to buy thread and other supplies for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es:
María Fidelina es soltera  tiene  treinta años de edad y estudio hasta el tercero de secundaria deseando seguir estudiar pero por falta de recursos solo hasta ahí estudio.

     Ella es la segunda vez que solicita el préstamo con fundación realidad y es para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía, como son: huevo, harina, aceite, frijol, jabón, cloro, galletas, entre otros para surtir  su tienda de abarrotes.
     
     Lo que lo motivo a dedicarse  a este tipo de negocio fue su  familia ya que para ayudarse con los  ingresos tenias que trabajar en algo que le dé un buen resultado, en donde  comenta que si le está yendo bien ya quien con el crédito a podido estarse surtiendo con más cosas que sus clientes le  compran.

     Su más grande deseo es que pueda continuar con su pequeña actividad y así lograr tener sus ahorro0s para que salga adelante como su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Fidelina, 33, is single.  She has three years of high school, but had to drop out because there wasn't enough money for her to continue.

This is her second Fundacion Realidad loan and she will use it to buy merchandise for her general store: eggs, flour, cooking oil, beans, soap, cleaning supplies, snacks, etc.  

Maria Fidelina's motive for starting the business was her family.  She wanted to help support them and she knew that she had to work at something that would provide her a good return.  She says that she's pleased with the business because the loans have helped her stock her store with the products that her customers most want to buy.

She wants to continue operating the business so that the income from it can help to support her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Edith Akomou

texts.fr:
Édith est mariée et a à charge 4 enfants, qui évoluent très bien à l'école. Elle réside en location avec ses enfants et son mari qui est chauffeur en service à SIBEAU, une société de la place. Elle est aidée dans le ménage par son mari en ce qui concerne les charges du ménage. 
Dotée d'une expérience d'au moins 16 ans, Édith prépare et vend de divers mets dans une boutique à son domicile sise à Calavi. A ceci, elle a associé la distribution des tissus de marques HITAGET, VLISCO et autres à des habitants de sa zone commerciale et de ses environs. Édith fait ses approvisionnements au marché international du Bénin nommé Tokpa. Elle sollicite et obtient le renouvellement d'un appui financier à FINADEV pour le développement de son activité afin de faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle. Elle est maintenant à son 3ème crédit. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par ledit appui lui permettra d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Édith souhaiterait voir son commerce connaître de l'évolution dans l'avenir.
texts.en:
Édith is married and supports four children, who are doing very well in school. She rents a place with her children and husband, who is a driver at SIBEAU, a local company. She is aided at home by her husband when it comes to household expenses. 

Priviledged with at least sixteen years of experience, Édith makes meals and sells them in a stall outside her home located in Calavi. Along with this, she has included the distribution of fabrics with the brand names of HITAGET, VLISCO, and others. Her customers are those living in her commercial district and nearby. She stocks up at the international market of Benin called Tokpa. 

Édith requested and received the renewal of a loan at FINADEV for developing her business, so as to cope with the needs of her customer. She is now on her third loan. The extra revenues generated by this financial support will enable her to improve her family’s living conditions. Édith would like to see her business experience progress in the future.

loans.use: to buy five 25-kg sacks of rice, two sacks of beans, and thirty length of cloth

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia, vive en unión libre con el señor  Rosendo y con quien procreo cuatro hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad  y son: Juana de Jesús de doce años de edad, Luisa  de nueve años de edad, Andrés de siete año de edad, y la más pequeña es Micaela de dos años de edad.
   Ella se dedica a  la artesanía  desde hace  veinte años y cuatro meses. Ella comenta comenta que le va bien en las ventas, por ello solicitó  el préstamo para invertirlo en la  compra de mantas, hilos para poder elaborar las blusas y luego bordarlas.
  Lo que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue su mamá quien se dedica a lo mismo  y ella desde pequeña  comenzó a practicarlo y ve que si le queda bien sus bordes que le elabora a cada blusa y es como sus clientes le compra su mercancía.
  Su más grande sueño es que con ello pueda seguir trabajando para a si lograr sacar adelante a sus hijos que están creciendo.
texts.en:
Silvia is in a common law relationship with Rosendo.  They have four children still in their care.  They are: Juana de Jesús, 12, Luisa, 9, Andrés, 7 and the youngest, Micaela, 2.

She’s been an artisan for the last twenty years and four months.  She comments that she does well with the sales and this is why she asked for a loan to invest in the purchase of fabric and thread to make blouses and then embroider them.

Her mother motivated her to go into this activity since she’s in it too.  From a very young age, she started to do it and sees that the embroidery she does on each blouse turns out well and her customers buy her merchandise.

Her greatest dream is that she’ll be able to continue in business to move her children, who are still in school, forward.

loans.use: to pay for thread and fabric to embroider.

loans.name: Afiam Maame

texts.en:
Afiam is married and has a senior high school educational background. She sells provisions such as milk, canned fish, rice and other items in Abura, which she has done for just a year. Her husband is a farmer.  She assists her husband in taking care of their home. 

Afiam will use the loan to purchase more provisions sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: buy more provisions resell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana  vive en unión libre con el señor  Rosendo y con quien procreo ocho hijos quienes siete ya están casados y una aun esta a su responsabilidad y se llama Lorena de dieciocho años de edad.

    Ella se dedica a  la elaboración de blusas de mantas para luego venderlo  ya bordado. Ella solicitó el préstamo para invertirlo en  la compra de hilos y mantas para así venderla ya listas, en done lleva cuarenta años dedicándose a esta actividad que es con lo que saco adelante a su familia.
   Lo que lo motivo a esta actividad fueron sus papás quienes también se dedicaban a lo mismo y le enseñaron a bordar para cuando sea casara con pueda apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y así juntos salir adelante.
    Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad  pueda seguir trabajando  hasta que Dios le preste vida y así  también pueda  continuar con el préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana is in a live in relationship with Rosendo and they have eight children, all but one are all married now.  Lorena is the only one who still lives at home.  She is 18 years old.

Juana makes embroidered blouses which she then sells.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy thread and embroidered blouses in order to be able to have them ready-made.  She has been doing this for forty years and this is the way she got her family ahead.

Her parents motivated her to do this, as they also worked in the same field and they taught her how to embroider so that she could help her husband support the household and together come out ahead.

What she wants most out of this activity is to continue working as long as God gives her life and in this way continue repaying this loan.

loans.use: to buy thread and blouses

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo, tiene la edad de 51 años, está casado, vive con sus3 hijos y su esposa. El pretende con el dinero realizar la compra de una vaca para el engorde. Ella compra ganando para engorde lo mantiene en su finca y cuando esta para listo para su venta lo vende al comercio de la zona generándole así ganancias para su bienestar. Ella con esa compra quiere aumentar la cantidad de animales a su poder y así tener más animales luego para su posterior venta y aumentar las ganancias para lograr varios proyectos de vida. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Arturo, 51, is married and living with his three children and his wife.  He intends to use the money to buy a cow to raise.  He buys cattle to raise that he keeps on his farm and when it’s ready for sale he sells it in the local market to generate income for his wellbeing.  He wants to increase the number of animals he has in order to have more for subsequent sale and increased profits to carry out life projects.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has had no previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Oswaldo Jose

texts.es:
Luego de que Oswaldo pasara por una situación económica difícil, unos amigos le hacen la propuesta de trabajar como vendedor de mercancía en la calle y le enseñaron todo lo referente al negocio.

Es entonces cuando Oswaldo inicia su negocio de venta de gafas para el sol en la calle y es así como ha sostenido a su familia conformada por su compañera y sus 2 hijos.

El quiere tener un surtido mas variado para incrementar sus venta y para así poderle brindar a su familia una mejor calida de vida a través del incremento de sus ventas.
texts.en:
After he had been through a difficult financial situation, Oswaldo's friends suggested he started selling merchandise in the street.  They taught him everything he needed to know about the business.

Oswaldo started a business selling sunglasses in the street.  This is how he has supported his family which consists of his partner and their two children.

Oswaldo would like to have a greater stock of items in order to increase his sales and thereby be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua sells gari, second-hand clothes and utensils in Abura.  She has received a senior high school education. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a driver.   

Akua has been selling second-hand clothes for 10 years. She assists her husband in taking care of their home. Her loan will be used to buy more second-hand clothes to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: buy secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Nataly

texts.en:
Nataly is 25 years old and lives with her partner and her young daughter. Her occupation is selling corn. Nataly sells corn to various clients around the city of Cusco. 

She is asking for a loan in order to further invest in her business. She plans to purchase more corn in hope that she can acquire more clients and therefore, make a greater amount of profits. 

Nataly is a hardworking woman and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase more corn to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Marcelina le esta haciendo falta los acabados del interior.
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material que necesita ya que es cemento, pintura, madera y pagarle a la persona que contrato para realizar la mejora. 
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su hijo y que este en mejores condiciones para su desarrollo y así evitar enfermedades. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una compañía con asistente de recursos humanos, ya que es madre soltera y es la única fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
The home of Señora Marcelina needs its interiors finished.  She is applying for a loan to buy the materials she needs, which are cement, paint, wood and to pay the person she has contracted to do the upgrade.  She wants to improve her child's inheritance, and live in better conditions for his development and to avoid illness.

She plans to repay the loan with part of the salary she receives from her job as a human resources assistant at a company.  She is a single mother and this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to finish the interiors of her home.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia, natural de la ciudad de Sivia tiene 44 años de edad, madre de 01 hijo llamado Aldair de 12 años por quien vela a diario y en futuro promisorio hacer de él hombre de bien. Ella esta casada con Felipe de 59 años y cuentan con casa propia situada en la comunidad de Triboline anexo de la ciudad de Sivia. Teodosia desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a ganarse la vida y pagar sus estudios con el esfuerzo de si misma, ella tuvo una infancia muy dura de la cual tuvo que salir adelante, cuando tenía 19 años se independizó de sus padres y dejó de ser empleada de hogar y abrió su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes, instalada en la casa de sus padres. Desde entonces empezó a vender productos y con el transcurso del tiempo más sus ahorros acumulados compro su propio lote de terreno donde actualmente se sitúa su bodega. Ella es una mujer de armas tomar y señala que uno logra su propósito a base de perseverancia. Hoy se siente a gusto con la actividad que realiza y con los buenos ingresos que obtiene, es mas, ella tiene casi todos los productos que sus clientes requieren y sumarle la buena atención que da  al cliente, hace que la bodega de Teodosia sea tan concurrida.
Ella necesita el crédito para seguir prosperando y prestando el buen servicio a sus consumidores. Necesita comprar mostradores y mesas para exhibir con mayor estética sus mercaderías y sabe que lo logrará gracias al apoyo de los financistas. Este es su quinto  crédito de Teodosia y esta muy contenta de saber que obtendrá el apoyo de ustedes, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo sugerido y  esta muy contenta  de pertenecer  a su banca comunal. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará, mostradores y mesas para exhibir mejor sus productos.
texts.en:
Teodosia, 44, is a native of the city of Sivia.  She has a 12-year old boy named Aldair, the light of her life, for whom she works hard to provide a good future.  She and her husband, Felipe, 59, live in a house they own in the Triboline neighborhood of Sivia.  Teodosia learned very young that she had to earn her way in the world and she even paid for her own schooling.  She had a tough childhood, but she managed to overcome it.  She started supporting herself at 19, working as a cleaner and opening a general store in a space in her parents' house.   She's sold lots of merchandise since then and was able to save enough eventually to buy the land where her store now sits.  She is a determined woman and says that perseverance is the key to success.  She is pleased with her business now and with the income that it's generated.  She has almost all of the products that her customers want and that, along with her attention to service, make her general store one of the busiest around.  
Teodosia needs this loan so that she can continue to prosper.  She will use the loan to buy counters and tables for exhibiting her merchandise in the best possible way.  This is her fifth loan and she knows how valuable past loans have been for supporting her business.  She is happy with her community bank and grateful to all of you for your past support.  Teodosia will use this loan of 3,000 new soles to buy counters and tables to display her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy fixtures for her general store.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and has 2 children. She has received a junior high school education. Sarah sells second-hand cloths in Abura, which she has done for 3 years. Her husband is a driver. 

Sarah uses her income to support her spouse in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use this loan to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to save towards building a shop.

loans.use: buy second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: The Tamarrneh United Group

texts.en:
Abibatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She lives in Kenema city. She is 29 years old and is married with three children. For many years now, Abibatu has been selling slippers/flip-flop sandals. Abibatu will use her share of the loan (800,000 Sierra Leone leones) to expand her business; she will buy dozens of slippers to add to her current stock. 

This is the second loan that Abibatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy dozens of slippers to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is a seamstress. For an additional income, she also sells soft drinks at the Abura market. The refrigerator near her in the picture is the one used to chill the drinks.

Afia has a junior high educational background. She and her husband, who is a farmer, have two children, and both parents help to pay school fees, utility bills, and other family expenses. 

Afia's loan will be used to buy more cloth and lining to sew into clothing to offer for sale. She intends to use the new profits from her business to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and lining to sew into clothing to offer for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells banku and secondhand socks at Watreso near Abura in the Central Region of Ghana. Ama has been through junior high school. She is married and has two children. Her business is eight years old. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of her home. Her loan will be used to buy additional socks to re-sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy additional socks to re-sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: The picture above depicts Ama standing close to the palm fruits ready to be processed into oil for sale at Abura. Ama has been through senior high school. She is married and has eight children. Her husband is a farmer. Ama has been into palm oil production for three years. She assists her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to process into oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruits to process into oil.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is divorced and has two children. Akua sells banku and salted fish (locally called kako) at Abura, which she has done for five years. Her ex-husband assists her in taking care of the home. Akua will use the loan to purchase more salted fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Akua plans to reinvest back into the business for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more salted fish to sell.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La señora Evangelina es  casada con el señor  Inocencio y cinco  quien  procreo cuatro hijos quienes tres ya están casados y uno está a su responsabilidad y es  Carlos Eduardo de dieciocho años de edad.
   Ella se dedica a su hogar a la elaboración de tamales de mole, de masa y de chipilín, y solicito  el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes que necesita apara realizar su actividad  que es con la que se está apoyando  con los ingresos de su hogar.
   Lo que  lo motivo a ello fue su familia ya que para salir adelante y tener lo más necesario   se dedicaría a una actividad que el de un mejor rendimiento para tener un poco mas de dinero.
     Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda tener sus propios ahorros para seguir apoyando a su hijo que está estudiando.
texts.en:
Sra. Evangelina and her husband, Sr. Inocencio, have four children, three of whom are married and independent.  Their youngest child, Carlos Eduardo, is eighteen years old.  
Evangelina operates a business making and selling tamales de mole, tamales de masa, and tamales de chipilin.  She is applying for a loan so that she can buy the ingredients she needs to continue the business and generate the income that she needs to support her family.
She started the business to help her family and she hit upon making and selling tamales because it seemed like the most likely way for her to earn the income she needed.
What she most wants now is to ensure that her little business generates enough income to allow her to help her son finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tamales business.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is a palm oil extractor. She also makes and prepares a popular meal, kenkey with fried fish, at the Abura market, as shown in the picture above. She has been in this trade for three years.

Araba and her husband, who is a farmer, have five children. Both parents support each other in helping to pay the household expenses, including school fees and utility bills. 

Araba's loan will be used to buy additional bags of maize with which to make kenkey to offer for sale. She intends to use the new profits from her business to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of maize with which to make kenkey to offer for sale

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamín, tiene la edad de 61 años, está casado, vive con su hija, nieta  y su esposa. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra del equipo necesario para seguir con el proyecto apícola. El cuenta ya con una pequeña granja establecida  y lo que quiere es fortalecer el proyecto para seguir avanzando con él. El quiere lograr con su granjita seguir abasteciendo el mercado local de su comunidad y también producir para vender en lugares donde se pueda comercializar para así generar ganancias para su bienestar y el de su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en: Benjamin, 61, is married.  He lives with his wife, daughter and grandchild.  He plans to use this loan to buy equipment for a bee-keeping project.  He already has a small operation and he wants to move it forward now.  He plans to continue supplying honey to his local market and produce enough to sell to commercial vendors.  His goal is to generate earnings for himself and his family.  This is his first FUDECOSUR loan.  He has never borrowed from a state bank, but FUDECOSUR provided the loan without a lot of requirements and at an attractive rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy equipment for honey bees-ness.

loans.name: Idolina

texts.es:
La señora idolina es casada con el señor Flavio y con quien procreo dos hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad  y son: Fabio de Jesús de veintidós años de edad y Fernando Rubiel de seis años de edad.
    Ella es ama de casa y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra material  como  son: hilos, agujas, hilos de  estambres para elaborar, manteles, sobre bufandas, tapetes, en donde lleva ocho meses  y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen resultado en su pequeña actividad.
    Lo que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue su  familia quienes es  lo mas importante para ella, darle lo mas necesario para que sigan delante aun así cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en el campo y así juntos salir adelante como familia.
    Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda mejorar su estado económico, para seguir apoyando a sus hijos a que sigan estudiando  y logren terminar una carera.
texts.en:
Idolina is married to Flavio.  They have two children still in their care: Fabio de Jesús, 22, and Fernando Rubiel, 6.

She is a housewife and requested the loan to buy supplies like: thread, needles, yarn, tablecloths, scarves, mats.  She’s been in business 8 months and comments that she does well because she’s had good results from her small business.

Her family who are the most important thing for her motivated her to go into this activity.  She wanted to provide them with the best so that they can go forward even though she has support from her husband who works in the fields and this way they can continue making progress as a family.

What she wants with this small business is to improve her economic situation to continue supporting her children so that they can stay in school and complete a career.

loans.use: to buy fabric and embroidery thread.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is married and has one child. She has been through junior high school. She sells underwear and slippers in Watreso near Abura, which she has done for one year. Her husband is a farmer. 

Faustina uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of the home. She will use the loan to purchase more underwear to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more underwear to sell.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora María de Jesús, es soltera y vive  con su mamá y  una hermana.
  Ella se dedica a la elaboración de panes y solicito el préstamo para  invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes  como son: huevo, harina, aceite, quesos, royal, entre otros, para la elaboración de su actividad, en este pequeño trabajo lleva siete años seis meses y comenta que le va bien ya que con ellos a tenido un buen ingresos dentro de su negocio y su familia.

   Lo que lo motivo a esta actividad fue su mamá quien fue que la enseño para que con el tiempo ellas sede dicaran a lo mismo así cuando se casaran  pudieran trabajar y apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa.
    
    Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad pueda seguir trabajando para mejoras su estado económico y así seguir apoyando a su familia  quienes dependen de ella.
texts.en:
María de Jesús is single and lives with her mother and a sister.

She sells breads and asked for the loan to invest in buying ingredients such as: eggs, flour, oil, cheeses and baking powder, among others, to make her products. She has worked in this small business for seven years and says that it is going well since she has had good earnings in the business and her family.

What motivated her to start this activity was her mother, who was the one who taught her so that in time both daughters would do this work, and when they got married they could work and help their husbands with the household income.

What María wants most is to keep working in this business to improve her financial status and continue supporting her family, who depend on her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like: flour, eggs, oil, cheese, sugar and others for making breads.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa earns her living by processing and selling "gari," a Ghanaian staple. Gari is a type of flour made from cassava and is a starchy food that is mostly enjoyed by students and large families in Ghana. Students eat gari a lot because it is a quick and easy food to prepare. They soak gari mix with condensed milk and water, and sometimes add peanuts. Some students also prepare gari in the form of dough and eat it with pepper sauce and sardines. Families also eat gari for lunch or supper, usually served with soup or pepper sauce. The soups that are mostly accompanied with gari are okra soup, groundnut (peanut) soup, palm nut soup, and vegetable soup. Various sauces can also be used to accompany gari, such as pepper sauce, curry sauce, or tomato sauce. The variety of the sauce served with gari depends on the family’s preferences. Any kind of meat or fish can be eaten with these soups and sauces.

To prepare the gari, Adjoa obtains raw, fresh cassavas from the market. She washes and peels the cassavas, then sends them to the mill to be milled into dough. She puts the dough in a sack and places heavy stones on it. The stones are placed to drain the starch out of the dough. She leaves the dough for a day or two depending on the weight of the stones. After this process is completed, she stir-fries the gari in a pan on fire. The gari is then left to cool and finally bagged into small bags that are then offered for sale. Adjoa sells her wares at the Abura market.

Adjoa and her husband, who is a farmer, have eight children. 

Adjoa has been selling gari for 15 years. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava to be processed into gari. She plans to use the new profits from her business to buy a plot of land. 

In the picture above, Adjoa is shown sitting near the bags of dough to be used for preparing gari.

loans.use: to buy more cassava to be processed into gari.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dozens of garden eggs to add to her business.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa displays food items like pepper, tomatoes, okra, onions, garlic, garden eggs and others at Abura. Yaa has received a junior high education. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. Yaa has been selling food items for three years. Her loan will be added to her capital to acquire additional food items to sell. She hopes to one day build a shop with her increased capital.

loans.use: to acquire additional food items to sell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, tiene la edad de 44 años, está divorciada, vive con su hija que es su mayor prioridad. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para su asistencia de su cafetal. Ella cuenta con el terreno sembrado de café en una zona apta para la explotación del cultivo en buenas condiciones por lo cual es que ella quiere invertir en estas mejoras. Ella quiere poder obtener mejores cosechas este año y así poder seguir generando el bienestar de su hija y el de ella en su futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Sonia is 44 years old. She is divorced and lives with her daughter, who is her top priority.

With her loan, she intends to buy supplies for her coffee farm. She has the land sown with coffee in an area that is good for coffee-growing, which is why she wants to invest in these improvements. She wants to get better harvests this year so she can continue ensuring her own and her daughter's well-being in the future.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has never had loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow coffee

loans.name: Paraiso Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  Paraíso  sus integrantes  le pusieron así por que a partir desde  que  fundación realidad les dio el préstamo  se sienten en el  paraíso ya que vivían con  preocupaciones.
Este grupo esta conformado por  once  integrantes  y  tiene  que reunirse cada  catorce días para realizar sus pagos. Tienen un comité  que  lo gobierna.
El representante  del grupo se llama  Benito  tiene  cuarenta ocho años de edad , estudio hasta la segundaria terminada ,y tiene tres hijos  todos  varones mayores de edad ya están casados. El se dedica  a la  compra de leñas y reparación de  camionetas cuenta con servicio automotriz y necesita el préstamo para comprar mas herramientas para arreglar las camionetas por que en ocasiones se atrasa en sus trabajos por falta de material.
Uno de sus sueños es   hacer mas  grande  su negocio ya que cuenta con muchos clientes  y no los quisiere  perder por falta de material ò por falta de tiempo.
  
Los otros  integrantes   se llaman :
Yesica Ivon – se dedica  a la venta de perfumes .
Victoria  Virginia- a la venta de tamales.
Alfonsina – se dedica a la  de totopos.
Fernando – se dedica a la elaboración de postres.
Remedios   Teresita - se dedica a la elaboración de  plásticos.
Antonio- se dedica a la  venta de refrescos.
Adriana – se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Arsenio- se  dedica a la  venta  chiles y semillas.
Daniel- se dedica a la costurera.
Patricia-venta de zapatos


Están muy contentos y agradecidos con fundación por ser de  parte de sus logros para salir adelante y así cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
This group is called Paraíso (Paradise). The members gave it this name because they used to be very worried, and since Fundación Realidad gave them the loan they feel like they are in Paradise.

The group has eleven members and must meet every two weeks to make its payments. They have a committee to govern them.

The group representative is named Benito. He is 48 years old, studied through the end of high school, and has three children, all boys who are now grown and married. He sells firewood and repairs trucks. He depends on his automotive service and needs the loan to buy more tools for fixing trucks because on occasion he falls behind in his work for lack of materials. One of his dreams is to make his business larger since he has many customers and does not want to lose them due to lack of materials or lack of time.

The other members are: 
Yesica Ivon -- she sells perfumes.
Victoria Virginia- tamale sales.
Alfonsina- she sells totopos [translator's note: a regional food similar to tortilla chips].
Fernando- he sells desserts.
Remedios Teresita- she sells plastic items.
Antonio- he sells soft drinks.
Adriana- she sells footwear.
Arsenio- he sells chiles and seeds.
Daniel- works as a tailor.
Patricia- shoe sales.

They are very happy and grateful to Fundación for being a part of their achievements in getting ahead and making their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy auto repair equipment

loans.name: Toronjil Huazolo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama, Toronjil  Huazolo sus integrantes decidieron ponerle así por que así se llama su colonia. Las integrantes son once personas que tienen que reunirse semanalmente para realizar sus pagos. Tiene un representante y un comité que los gobierna. Este grupo esta ubicado en la ciudad de  Santa  María   Huazolotitln estado de Oaxaca. 
Adelfa  es parte del comité de este grupo, ella terminó de estudiar Bachillerato y tiene un 32 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de Calzado por catálogos, pidió el préstamo por que lo va invertir en compra y venta de ropa típica. Sus clientes le pedían la ropa típica tanto como collares por que antes de vender calzado vendía ropa típica, ella es una señora muy amable con sus clientes. 
Su sueño es comprar ropa típica y hacer un local para dedicarse solamente a vender ropa típica. Le dan las gracias a fundación realidad por el apoyo que les ha dado a todas para hacer realidad sus sueños. 
Las  otras integrantes son:
Josefina  : se dedica a la venta de blusas.
María : se dedica ala venta de  pan.
Narcisa .  se dedica al la venta de blusas.
Camelia : se dedica a la venta  de antojitos.
Margarita:  se dedica a la venta de collares.
Acacia : se dedica  a la venta de pasteles.
Modesta se dedica a la  venta de vestidos.
Magdalena: se dedica a la venta de vestidos.
Aurora: se dedica a la venta de artesanías.
Liliana: compra y venta de ropa

Le dan las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que les ha dado para  salir adelante y ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is named Toronjil Huazolo. The members decided to give it this name because it is the name of their settlement. There are eleven members who have to meet weekly to make their payments. They have a representative and a committee that governs them. This group is located in the city of Santa María Huazolotitln in the state of Oaxaca.

Adelfa is part of the group's committee. She completed a Bachelor's degree and is 32 years old. She sells footwear by catalog, and she asked for the loan because she is going to invest it in the purchase and sale of traditional clothing. Her customers have been asking her for traditional clothing such as necklaces because she used to sell traditional clothing before she sold shoes. She is a lady who is very friendly with her customers. Adelfa's dream is to buy traditional clothing and set up a store so she can work only in sales of traditional clothing. 

The group thanks Fundación Realidad for the support they have all been given to make their dreams reality.

The other members are:
Josefina: she sells blouses.
María: she sells bread.
Nacariza: she sells blouses.
Camelia: she sells snacks.
Margarita: she sells necklaces.
Acacia: she sells cakes.
Modesta sells dresses.
Magdalena: she sells dresses.
Aurora: she sells handcrafts.
Liliana: buys and sells clothing.

The group thanks Fundación Realidad for the support they have all been given to get ahead and help their children.

loans.use: to buy shoes and traditional clothing.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 48 years old and lives with her partner. She has three children, one of whom still lives with her. 

Gregoria makes her living selling crafts such as colorful bags and knitted cell-phone pockets. She is asking for a loan in order to buy a wider range of crafts to sell. She plans to purchase colorful backpacks, knitted purses and knitted hats. 

She hopes that by expanding the variety of crafts she sells, she will be able to make greater profits. Gregoria is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more crafts to sell such as backpacks, little purses and knitted hats.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura, tiene la edad de 32 años, está casada, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de las semillas y insumos para las hortalizas. Ella quiere sembrar estos productos para el autoconsumo y la venta a nivel de la localidad. Ella quiere dejar de tener que comprar estos alimentos un comercios para así lograr quitar un gasto de su hogar al ella poderlas producir.
