texts.en: Ms. Nora is a member of the "Las Orquídeas" ["The Orchids"] communal bank, located in the district of Calleria and department of Ucayali. She is 54 years old and has three adult children. In order to start her business, she requested a loan from Manuela Ramos and also used whatever savings she had. She has now been working with loans through Manuela Ramos for four years. During this time, she has been able to develop her own business, which she tends to herself. She sells spare parts for motorcycles. Her husband helps her with her business. With this new loan of 3,000 nuevos soles, she will buy: 1 box of spark plugs, 1 box of rodajes, 10 chain rings, 12 clutch wires, 6 intermittent headlights, 10 gaskets, 10 wheels, 10 innertubes, and 6 pairs of shock absorbers. With these purchases, she hopes that in a short time she will be much better stocked so that she can offer her customers more variety and they will not need to go to the competition to make purchases. She is very grateful for the loans she has been offered by Manuela Ramos, as they have allowed her to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy spare motorcycle parts

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Callayuc que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura y ganadería.

Carlos desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado de Callayuc, cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad de leche que tiene, con sus ingresos solventará sus necesidades familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar más ganado vacuno de raza y su respectivo alimento para que se incremente la producción de la leche de vaca y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Carlos es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca para que sus hijos tengan otras oportunidades académicas.
texts.en:
Carlos is 28 years old and lives with his family in their own house, where light is the only service they have. It is located in the rural zone of the district of Callayuc, which belongs to the department of Cajamarca. In this zone, the main economic activities are agriculture and raising cattle.

For several years, Carlos has worked raising and selling cattle. His corral is located outside his house and he feeds his cattle a balanced diet and natural grasses so that their milk production will be good. He offers the milk to others who live in his zone or he brings it to sell at the market in Callayuc. He has regular customers because of the good quality of his milk. He uses his income to take care of his family's needs.

He has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more well-bred cattle and their proper foods, so that he can increase his milk production and thereby sell it at a better price to cover his loan repayments.  He would also like to improve his family's quality of life. Carlos is a hard-working and very responsible person. The only things he wants are for his business to grow and for his children to have more educational opportunities.

loans.use: to buy well-bred cattle and their proper food

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 37 años, ella es una mujer alegre y laboriosa y esta casada con Javier de 42 años y fruto de ello  tienen 06 hijos y viven en su propia casa. Olinda es una mujer  muy empeñosa y optimista, que decidió abrir su propio negocio hace 10 años, vendiendo ropa nacional e importada al gusto del cliente. Sin embargo este trabajo le resulta muy trabajoso pues sola se encarga, ya que no puede contar con el apoyo de otra persona, su esposo al igual que ella trabaja todo el día. Pero al margen de ello, su negocio tiene  éxito debido al buen trato que ofrece y al precio en que ofrece su mercadería. Ahora espera contar nuevamente con su apoyo para poder viajar a la ciudad de lima para comprar variedad de prendas. Pero su mayor anhelo es ampliar su espacio de ventas e implementarla  de más mercadería. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP y por lo cual se compromete a seguir pagando puntualmente sus cuotas y esta vez espera contar con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir prosperando. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará variedad de ropa en especial ropa de verano ya que el calor de la selva es muy intenso por ello les obliga a utilizar este tipo de ropa.
texts.en: Olinda, a resident of the city of Santa Rose, is 37-years-old.  She is a joyful and hard-working woman and is married to Javier who is 42-years-old.  They have six children and live in their own home.  Olinda is a woman who puts great effort into her work and is very optimistic.  Ten years ago she decided to open her own business selling clothing produced domestically and imported, to the taste of her customers.  However, this work is very hard for her because she is the sole person in charge and she can’t count on the help of anyone else.  Her husband works all day like her.  But apart from that her business is successful because of the good service she offers and the the prices she sells her merchandise at.  Now she hopes to count on support again to be able to travel to Lima to buy a variety of items of clothing.  Her greatest wish is to expand her sales space and stock it with more merchandise.  This is her seventh loan with MFP and as such she promises to continue making payments punctually and this time hopes to count with the help of the financers to continue to prosper.  With the 2000 nuevos soles she will buy a variety of items of clothing, particularly summer clothing as the heat in the forest is very intense and they have to use this type of clothing.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing items.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La Srta. María Isabel pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Lameñas” del Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 23 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos.

Cuando su papá falleció, su mamá se quedó sola al cuidado de su hermana y de ella, como necesitaban dinero decidió apoyar a su mamá y con un capital de S/. 300.00 empezó a vender en un puesto del mercado de su comunidad, chorizo, cecina y derivados, de esa manera comenzó a ganar dinero y ayudar a la economía de su casa.  Ella tiene muchos deseos de superarse, estudió una carrera técnica, pero no pudo terminarla.
Actualmente continúa desarrollando esa actividad y sus ventas han crecido, tiene clientes fijos que siempre buscan sus productos por la calidad e higiene con que los prepara.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 comprará  carne y vísceras para elaborar sus productos de cecinas, chorizo y ahumados de esa manera poder surtir su negocio y atraer nuevos clientes y mantener satisfechos a sus clientes actuales. 

María Isabel es una mujer creativa y emprendedora,  su sueño es terminar sus estudios  y contar con un negocio que le permita continuar apoyando a su madre y a su hermana, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad de iniciar su negocio y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
María Isabel belongs to the communal bank “Las Lamañas”  from the Lamas district in Lamas province and the department of San Martín.  She is 23-years-old, single, and has no children.

When her father died her mother stayed single and cared for her sister and for her.  As they needed money, she decided to support her mother and with a working capital of 300 nuevos soles began to sell chorizo, cecina, and other meat products in a market stand in her community.  In this way she began to earn money and help her household economy.  She has many hopes of getting ahead and studied a technical career, though she couldn’t finish it.  

Currently she continues developing this work and her sales have grown.  She has regular customers who always look for her products because of their quality and the good hygiene practices she follows when she prepares them.

With this loan of 1500 nuevos soles she will buy meats and viscera to make her products (cecina, chorizo, and smoked meats) and be able to stock her business and attract new customers and keep old customers satisfied.

María Isabel is a creative and entrepreneurial woman.  Her dream is to finish her studies and to have a business that will allow her to continue supporting her mother and sister.  She is very thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for offering her the opportunity to start her business and continue growing it.

loans.use: to buy meat to make cecina (a cured pork product), chorizo (spicy sausage), and cueros (fried pork skin).

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 40 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora,. Esta casada con Timoteo de 52 años y tienen 03 hijos en etapa escolar y juntos residen en su propia casa. Paulina trabaja arduamente desde sus 19 años, en aquellos años ella se dedicaba tan solo a la agricultura lo cual le servía solo para sostener a los miembros de su familia. Con sus ahorros acumulados abrió una tienda de abarrotes, en donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Es así que su puesto le genera buenas ganancias económicas, ella abre las puertas de su negocio desde muy tempranas horas en espera de sus primeros compradores. Menciona que la clave de captar mayores consumidores es atender amablemente y apoyarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es quedar bien con sus clientes, ya  lleva 10 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie  todo el transcurso del día. En su negocio le va muy bien ya que gracias a ello pudo adquirir mas espacio de terreno para cultivar donde trabaja su amado esposo. Con el dinero del crédito comprará suministros en cantidad para su puesto de ventas. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su vivienda y así agrandar  su  bodega. Este es su 20avo crédito y esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir creciendo. En su banco comunal es una socia participe y muy puntual en las reuniones. Con el dinero del crédito comprará mercadería como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes.
texts.en: Paulina, a resident of the city of Santa Rosa, is 40-years-old.  She is a down to earth and hard-working woman.  She is married to Timoteo who is 52-years-old and they have three school age children and they all live together in their own home.  Paulina has worked very hard since she was 19-years-old.  At that time she worked only in agriculture which only enabled her to maintain her family members.  With the savings she accumulated she opened a grocery store where she offers a variety of staple products.  This is how her stand generates good profits.  She opens the doors of her business very early in the morning to wait for her first buyers.  She mentions that the key to getting better customers is attending to them in a friendly manner and helping them with their purchases.  What she likes best about her work is having a good relationship with her customers.  Now she has been in this business for 10 years and considers the most difficult part to be having to be on her feet all day long.  Her business is going very well and thanks to this she was able to acquire more land to cultivate where her beloved husband works.  With the money from the loan she will buy supplies for her store.  With time, she hopes to expand her house and make her store bigger.  This is her twentieth loan and she is very happy to know that she will have support once more from all of you to continue growing.  In her communal bank she is a member who participates and is very punctual to meetings.  With the money from the loan she will buy merchandise like: sacks of rice, sugar, oils, and detergents.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, oil, and detergent to stock her store.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicios sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Chachapoyas que pertence al departamento de Amazonas.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería, artesanía y turismo.

Josefina se dedica a la elaboración, venta de chicha de jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base de maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú), cerveza y crianza de aves de corral, estas actividades los realiza desde hace varios años, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado de generación en generación. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas de la chicha de jora y cerveza en la zona donde vive, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  También comercializa aves de corral, lo que le permite ayudarse con otro ingreso.

Teniendo la oportunidad de crecer Josefina a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de cerveza, harina de maíz para la elaboración de chicha de jora y alimento balanceado para sus aves, con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Josefina is a 44 year-old mother. She lives with her husband and children in their own house. Light is the only service they have there. Their house is located in the rural zone of the district of Chachapoyas, which belongs to Amazonas department. The entire area is populated by people who work in agriculture, cattle, arts, and tourism. Josefina makes and sells chica de jora (a rich, corn-based beverage that is widely consumed in northern Peru), sells beer, and raises caged birds. She has been doing this type of work for many years, as it is a custom that has been passed down from generation to generation. Recently, she has been increasing her chica de jora and beer sales in the area where she lives, in order to increase her income and improve her family's quality of life. She also sells caged birds, which helps her because it is another source of income. Josefina has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternative because it is an opportunity to grow. She will buy a greater quantity of beer, corn flour for making chica de jora, and a balanced diet for her birds. Her goals are to obtain better profits and to increase her customers so that she can pay back her loan and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy: more beer, corn flour for making chicha de jora, and a balanced diet for her animals

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth es socia del banco comunal Las Orquídeas del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, está casada, tiene 44 años de edad y dos hijos.
Lleva dos años trabajando con Manuela Ramos. Tiene un negocio de ferretería ubicado en una de las calles principales de Pucallpa, cuenta con un puesto en una galería, donde pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo atendiendo a sus clientes. A pesar de que cuenta con un ayudante, tiene que estar al pendiente de todo, prefiere manejarlo así para asegurarse de dar una buena atención.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 10 cerrojos, 1 caja de candados, 3 rollos e cables de luz, 1 caja de cinta aislante, 1 caja de alicates.
En las tardes  tiene que estar con su hija en su negocio porque no tiene con quien dejarla en casa así es que aprovecha para darle un poco de atención y dedicarse a ella. 
Gracias a Manuela Ramos podrá poner una nueva tienda, de esa manera ampliará el negocio y podrá tener más ingresos y al mismo tiempo generar empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the "Las Orquídeas" (Orchids) community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 44 years old, married, and has two children.

Elizabeth has been working with Manuela Ramos for two years.  She has a hardware business which is located in one of the main streets of Pucallpa.  She has a stall in a shopping center where she spends most of her time serving her customers.  In spite of the fact that she has an assistant, she has to be on top of everything.  She prefers to run things this way so that she can ensure she is providing a good service.

Elizabeth will use her new loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy 10 bolts, 1 box of padlocks, 3 rolls of electricity cables, 1 box of insulating tape and 1 box of pliers.

In the afternoons, Elizabeth has to bring her daughter to her business because she doesn't have anybody to leave her at home with.  She makes the most of this time in order to give her a little attention and devote time to her.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Elizabeth will be able to set up a new store.  In this way, she will expand her business and be able to make more income.  At the same time, she will create employment for other people.

loans.use: to buy bolts, padlocks and cables

loans.name: Elias Roberto

texts.es:
Elias Roberto nació en el distrito de Echarate y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. La ciudad de Echarate es la ciudad capital del distrito de Echarate de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.). 

Elias Roberto es una persona responsable y le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Nueva Luz de Echarate” de la Asociación Arariwa.  

Él es agricultor y trabaja en sus terrenos de cultivo donde tiene cacao y frutales, él contrata gente para que le ayuda a cosechar los cultivos entonces necesita el crédito para pagar el sueldo de los peones. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y le está yendo muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Elias Roberto was born in the Echarate district and lives in the same city where he was born.  The city of Echarate is the capital city of the district of Echarate, in the La Convencion province.  It is an important commercial center for the Lares Valley and La Convencion province.  The main activities here are the production of cocoa, coffee, coca leaves and orchard fruits.

Elias Roberto is a responsible person who was invited to participate in the communal bank “Nueva Luz de Echarate” in the Asociación Arariwa.  

He is a farmer who works lands where he cultivates cocoa and grows fruit in orchards.  He hires people to help him harvest his crops and he needs a loan to pay for their wages.  He has been a farmer for a number of years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

loans.use: to pay the wages of his workers

loans.name: Jose De La Rosa

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque . Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera de los pobladores.

José se dedica desde algunos años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo puede ofrecer a sus clientes o a los distintos mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque y con los ingresos que obtenga pueda solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar más cerdos para su venta, también piensa incursionar en la comercialización de arroz, con la finalidad de que obtenga  más ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  José es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante.
texts.en:
José is a 30 year-old father who lives with his wife and children in his own home which only has electricity.  It is located in the rural area of Lambayeque department.  This area is noted for the farming and livestock raising carried out by the local people.

José has been raising and selling pigs for some years.  His pen is located behind his home.  He gives his animals balanced feed and, once they have reached an optimum level of growth, he can sell them to his customers or in the markets in Chiclayo and Lambayeque.  He is able to cover his household expenses with his income.

José has requested a loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more pigs to sell.  He is also planning to start selling rice with the goal of making more profits so that he can enjoy a better quality of life.  José is a hard-working and very responsible person.  The only thing he wants is for his family to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and also rice so that he can start out in a new business

loans.name: Julia Arlita

texts.es:
La Sra. Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal “28 de Julio” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene 33 años y 03 hijos que están en edad escolar.

Con la finalidad de apoyar en los gastos económicos de su hogar, decidió comprar un mototaxi para alquilarlo y de esa manera recibir diariamente un pago, con el tiempo ahorró y solicitó su préstamo a Manuela Ramos, de esa manera compró otra unidad más. Actualmente tiene una moto furgón más, la que utiliza para hacer servicio de carga.  Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, para cuando estén grandes poder venderlos, así ha contribuido con la economía de su hogar y saca adelante a sus hijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2500.00 dará mantenimiento y renovación de llantas de sus vehículos motorizados, también comprará alimentos para la crianza de sus cerdos.
 
Julia es una mujer luchadora, su sueño es poner un negocio en su casa y comprar un terreno donde pueda criar a sus animalitos, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella de hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the "28 de Julio” community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in Tarapoto province, in San Martín department.  She is 33 years old, married, and has three school-age children.

In order to support her husband with their household expenses, Julia decided to buy a motorcycle taxi to rent out which would make her daily income.  Over time she saved up and requested a loan from Manuela Ramos and used this money to buy another motorcycle taxi.  She currently has an additional vehicle which she uses to provide a cargo transport service.  In parallel with this business, she also raises pigs.  When they are fattened she sells them.  In this way, she contributes to her household financially and gets her children ahead in life.

Julia will use this loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles to maintain and renew the tires on her vehicles.  She will also buy feed for raising her pigs.

Julia is a tenacious woman.  Her dream is to set up a business in her home and to buy a plot of land where she can raise her animals.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for giving an opportunity to women such as herself to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to maintain and buy spare parts for her motorcycle taxis, and to buy pig feed

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila D. 55 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesanía.

Teofila se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sus propias tierras D. cultivo donD. siembra limón, actividad que realiza desD. hace varios, además D. ser un producto muy consumido por las personas, una vez que realiza su cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados D. la zona, también comercializa aves D. corral y ganado ovino, los alimenta con comida balanceada, sus corrales están en la parte posterior D. su caso, los cuales son amplios, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento ideal los venD. y con los ingresos que adquiera pueD. brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos y esposa.

A observar que su negocio va creciendo a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles para la compra D. abono para mejorarla cosecha D. limón y  alimento balanceado para sus animales, con sus ganancias podrá pagar su crédito y solventar sus necesidades diarias D. su familia.  Teofila con trabajo y dedicación les brinda lo mejor a sus hijos y más comodidades en casa para su familia.
texts.en:
Teofila is 55 years old.  She lives with her husband and children in her own home which only receives electricity service.  It is located in the rural area of TambogranD. district, in Piura department.  This area is noted for its farming, livestock raising and handicrafts.

Teofila is a farmer.  She owns her own farmland where she grows lemons and has been in this business for years.  This is a very popular product and once she harvests her lemons she sells them in the markets in her area.  She also sells farmyard birds and sheep which she provides with balanced feed.  Her large pens are located behind her home.  Once her animals have reached an ideal level of growth, she sells them and uses the income to proviD. her children and husband with a better quality of life.

Teofila has noticed that her business is growing and so she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy manure so that she can improve her lemon harvest.  She will also buy balanced feed for her animals.  She will use the profits to repay her loan and cover the daily needs of her family.  With hard work and commitment, Teofila provides the best for her children and more household comforts for her family.

loans.use: to buy manure to improve her lemon harvest, and balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa tiene 39 años de edad, convive con Melitón de 40 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 02 hijos Omar de 15 años y Devi de 13 años de edad,  juntos viven en su propia casa donde predomina la armonía. Ruth es docente de nivel primaria y cada día se esmera por entregar algo nuevo a sus alumnos, es así que labora en el centro educativo de Santa Rosa. Ella es una profesora muy querida por sus alumnos y padres de familia. Ruth se entrega por completo a su trabajo por que gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano pudo construir su casa a base de concreto armado a la vez compró su chacra donde los días no laborables acude ahí para brindarles todo su cuidado. Le gusta su trabajo como docente y estar pendiente de sus alumnos, quienes la agradecen por su paciencia y trato hacia ellos. Con el crédito solicitado comprará mayólicas para mejorar los pisos de su habitación. Para su futuro promisorio espera ser contratada nuevamente por el Gobierno Peruano ya que depende de ello  de seguir prestando sus servicios como profesora. Este será su noveno crédito con MFP y por tanto espera el apoyo de ustedes para mejorar el ambiente de su casa. En su banco comunal es una socia muy cooperadora.
Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar mayólicas para enchapar los pisos de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ruth is a native of the city of Santa Rosa.  She is 39 years old and lives with Melitón, aged 40, and their two children who are the fruit of their relationship.  Omar is 15 years old and Devi is 13.  They live together in their own home, where harmony prevails. 

Ruth is a primary school teacher and strives everyday to give something back to her students.  She works in the educational center of Santa Rosa.  She is a teacher who is much loved by students and parents.  Ruth gives herself completely to her work, and thanks to her daily efforts, they have been able to build their house on a base of reinforced concrete.  At the same time, she bought her farm; this is where she goes on days she's not working, so as to give the farm every care.  She likes her job as a teacher and keeps an eye out for her students; they are grateful to her for her patience and treatment of them.  

With the requested loan, she will buy tiles to improve the floors of her accommodation.  Her future looks promising, she hopes to be hired again by the Peruvian government since she depends on that to continue providing her services as a teacher. 

This will be her ninth loan through MFP, and therefore she hopes for your support to improve her home environment. She is a very cooperative member of her community bank.

With the support of the loan, she will be able to buy tiles to cover the floors of her home.

loans.use: to buy tiles.

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
Benigno nació en el distrito de Echarate y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. La ciudad de Echarate es la ciudad capital del distrito de Echarate de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.). 

Benigno tiene 23 años y es una persona responsable es padre de un hijo y le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Nueva Luz de Echarate” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
 
Él es chofer y trabajan en la ruta Cusco - Puerto Maldonado y viceversa. Ya son seis años que se dedica al servicio y le está yendo muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo. 

Benigno ha comprado un terreno pero a crédito en la ciudad de Echarate donde va cultivar cacao, fruta y otras cosas más. El accede al crédito para pagar las últimas cuotas que le falta.
texts.en:
Benigno was born in the district of Echarate, and lives in the city where he was born.  Echarate is the capital of the district of Echarate, province of La Convención, and a large commercial center for the Lares and La Convención valleys.  Major activities are production in coca, coffee, cacao, and fruit trees.

Benigno is 23 years old, responsible, and father of one child.  He was invited to join the Nueva Luz de Echarate communal bank, of the Arariwa Association.

He is a driver working the Cuzco-Puerto Maldonado route.  He has been providing this service for six years, and things are going well for him because he does his work conscientiously.

Benigno has purchased a piece of land, on credit, in Echarate, where he plans to grow cacao, fruit, and other things.  He is asking for a loan in order to pay the remaining installments.

loans.use: pay the last installments on his land.

loans.name: Renee

texts.es: Renee tiene 34 años, es natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, vive en su propia casa en compañía de su pareja Raúl de 36 años y sus 04 queridos hijos quienes la inspiran para seguir trabajando arduamente. Renee vive en las verdes praderas de su centro poblado, que la mantienen con gran fortaleza para trabajar, pues ella cultiva cacao y café productos que logró trabajarlos con mucha entrega para volverlos muy fructíferas. Renee viene labrando sus tierras desde sus 22 años y hoy es toda una conocedora de la ardua labor que se ejerce en el campo agrícola. En tiempos de cosecha y traslado de productos ella necesariamente tiene que contratar peones para apresurar su trabajo, cabe manifestar a su esposo es su consejero y su mano derecha en este trabajo. A Renee le gusta su trabajo por que gracias a ello construyo su vivienda con material de concreto armado. Por ello solicita el crédito para fortalecer sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas  razón por la cual acude a MFP para que pueda comprar sacos de abono orgánico,  ya que con ello sus plantas lucirán mas frondosos. Este es su quinto crédito, por la cual se siente muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo de parte de todos ustedes, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Renee is 34 years old, and a native of the city of Santa Rosa.  She lives at home with her partner Raúl, aged 36, and her four beloved children who inspire her to keep working hard.   

Renee lives in pastures around the village, which she maintains through working arduously. She cultivates cocoa and coffee, which she achieves by working with great dedication to make the crops fruitful.  Renee has been working her land since she was 22, and today she is an expert on the hard work required by agriculture.  At harvest time, and when they transport products, she needs to hire laborers to expedite her work.  It should be noted that her husband is her adviser, and her right hand in this work.

Renee loves her job, because thanks to it, she has been able to build her house with reinforced concrete.  She is requesting the loan to strengthen her land and make it highly productive.  This is why she has gone to MFP, so she can buy bags of organic manure, as this will make her plants more lush.

This is her fifth loan.  She is very happy to know that she will have support from all of you, so she feels safe in buying what's requested and is willing to make repayments promptly. 

With the 1,000 New Soles, she will buy bags of organic manure to fertilize her land.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic manure.

loans.name: María Ciria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ciria, tiene 72 años de edad, hace varios años el compañero de toda su vida falleció pero de esa relación tuvo 12 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes, una de sus hijos aun vive con ella.
 
Nuestra amiga es una mujer muy trabajadora y que para lograr tener para sus gastos hace varios años se dedica al comercio, vende productos naturales, productos tanto personales como para el hogar (planchas, zapatos, licuadoras, entre otras cosas), estos los vende a través del sistema de cartillas, su forma de venta es puerta. Lleva más de 15 años dedicada al comercio y le ha ido muy bien. Ella también utiliza parte del crédito para darle a su hijo para su negocio pues vende queso en el mercado local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos naturales, productos para el hogar y queso para el negocio del hijo. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 11 años y le gusta porque le han ayudado mucho con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local en su casa.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the "Mujeres con Esperanza" community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarinds owing to the large quantity of tamarind trees that used to exist there years ago.

Here we meet 72 year-old Ciria.  Several years ago Ciria's life partner died but she had 12 children from that relationship who are all now grown up and living independently.  One of her children still lives with her.

Our friend is a very hard-working woman and, in order to cover her expenses, years ago she started working in commerce, selling natural products, and both personal products and products for the home (irons, shoes, blenders, etc.).  She sells these through a credit system.  She makes her sales door to door.  She has been in business for 15 years and has done very well.  She will use part of her loan to give to her son for his business as he sells cheese in the local market.

Ciria will use this loan to buy natural products, products for the home and cheese for her son's business.  She has belonged to her loan group for 11 years and she likes it because they have helped her a lot with the loans.  Her dream is to have business premises in her home.

loans.use: to buy natural products, household products and cheese

loans.name: Geoconda Jacinta

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Geoconda, tiene 40 años de edad, está separada   pero de esa relación que tuvo hace varios años tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 18, 16 y 14 años de edad, el mayor de ellos está en Universidad, los tres restantes estudian en colegio,  todos sus hijos  viven en su casa.

Ella es una muy buena madre que para que no les falte nada a sus hijos y lograr darles una buena educación se dedica a trabajar incansablemente,  trabaja todos los días en las mañanas en una cevicheria de la ciudad en la que recibe un pago mensual, pero en las noches de los días sabados y domingos  ella tiene su propio negocio, tiene una carreta en la que vende comidas rápidas, allí vende hot dog y hamburguesas, además de jugos y sodas de todos los sabores,  esto también lo realiza en los días cuando hay ferias y fiestas en su pueblo ya que le dejan buenas ganancias en estos días, lleva  tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y esto  le ha servido para poder sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pan, carne, salchichas, chorizo, sodas, aguas, jugos y otros ingredientes para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace ocho ciclos  y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito puso su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Con Esperanza” (Women with Hope) meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. Portoviejo has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos” because of the large quantities of tamarind fruit that are produced this time of year.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Geoconda. She is 40 years old and has been separated from her spouse for several years. Geoconda has four children (ages 19, 18, 16, and 14). The oldest child is attending university while the other three are in high school. All of her children live at home.

Geoconda is a good mother who sees that her children lack nothing. She works tirelessly in order to provide them a good education. Geoconda works every day in the mornings at a “cevicheria” (a restaurant that serves marinated seafood cocktails) in the city and earns a monthly wage. On Saturday and Sunday nights, she operates her own business. She has a cart from which she sells fast food, such as hot dogs and hamburgers. Geoconda also sells juices and sodas of all flavors. In addition, she sells food on the days when there are fairs and festivals being held in her town. She is able to generate good profits on these days. Geoconda has been in business for three years and it has enabled her to move her family forward.

This loan will be used to buy bread, meat, sausages, chorizo, sodas, water, juices, and other ingredients used in preparing her food. She has participated in eight loan cycles with the Communal Bank. Geoconda likes being a member because her first loan was used to start her business. Her dream is to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase bread, meat, sausages, chorizo, sodas, water, juices, and other ingredients.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Esperanza.

Aquí conocimos a la señora María tiene 63 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  seis hijos los mismos que ya son mayor de edad, pero dos de ellos aun viven en su casa, uno de ellos está comprometido y tiene dos hijos pequeños que son la felicidad de nuestra amiga. Lleva en el Grupo De Crédito algunos años y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha salido de muchos inconvenientes económicos.

Ella tiene un negocio en su casa en el cual vende hielo en fundas y tarjetas telefónicas, también se dedica a la cría de gallinas criollas, nos cuenta que estas últimas se venden a muy buen precio ya que son muy apetecidas tanto para persona de la localidad como para los turistas, ella entrega las gallinas a un restaurante de la ciudad que le paga muy bien, en cuanto sus otras ventas las realiza todos los días en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar alimentos para las gallinas y tarjetas telefónicas para la venta.
 
Sus sueños son tener una granja bien construida y poder dedicarse a criar estos animalitos en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Con Esperanza” (Women with Hope) meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. Portoviejo has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos” because of the large quantities of tamarind fruit that are produced this time of year.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. María. She is 63 years old and a single mother with six grown children. Two of them still live at home. One child is engaged and has two small children who bring her happiness. María has been with the Communal Bank for a few years and enjoys being a member because the loans have helped her get out of many difficult financial situations.

She has a business in her home selling bags of ice and phone cards. María also raises chickens. She says that lately the chickens have been selling at very good prices because people from the area, as well as tourists, find them very appetizing. María delivers the chickens to a restaurant in the city that pays her well. Her other sales are made every day to customers who come to her house.

This loan will be used to buy feed for her chickens and phone cards to sell. Her dreams are to have a well-built chicken farm and to spend more time raising these small animals in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens and phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Margoin Yackeline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Margoin, ella tiene  40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos dos de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y dos de 14 y 1 años de edad, todos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de productos lácteos tales como la deliciosa leche, queso, yogurt y mantequilla, productos que son muy consumidos por las familias manabitas, ellos venden por separado ya que  mientras él sale a entregar en su carro ella vende en su casa  a los clientes que dia a dia se acercan hasta su local, allí mismo  ella también vende bidones de agua lo cual lo realiza al mismo tiempo que vende sus otros productos, trabajan todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 18h00. Los productos los compran en Portoviejo a comerciantes que entregan al por mayor, llevan seis años que se dedican a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar leche, queso, yogurt, mantequilla y bidones de agua. Lleva en el Grupo De Crédito ya más de tres años y le gusta porque los créditos sirven para impulsar los negocios.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local más grande en el centro de la  ciudad.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Con Esperanza” (Women with Hope) meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. Portoviejo has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos” because of the large quantities of tamarind fruit that are produced this time of year.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Margoin.  She is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  Two of her children are grown and the other two are aged 14 and 1.  They all live at home.  Her husband is a merchant.  

Together with her husband, Margoin sells delicious dairy products such as milk, cheese, yogurt, and butter.  These products are widely consumed by families in Manabí.  Margoin and her husband work separately.  While he is out making deliveries by car, she sells products at home to customers who come to her shop on a daily basis.  There she also sells barrels of water along with her other products.  Margoin works every day from 7am to 6pm.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo from wholesale merchants.  Margoin has been in business for six years.

This loan will be used to buy milk, cheese, yogurt, butter, and barrels of water.  She has been with the Communal Bank for more than three years and likes the fact that the loans were used to start her business.  Her dream is to have a larger shop in the central part of the city.

loans.use: to purchase milk, cheese, yogurt, butter, and barrels of water.

loans.name: Placida Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Placida, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 6 años el mismo que estudian en escuela. El marido es infante de marina.
 
Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Oriflame (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa la va comprar a Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, ella está con la idea de poner una cevichería en el centro de la ciudad y próximamente hará esto realidad.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva seis años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para financiar su negocio. 

Sus sueños son tener un local en el centro de la  ciudad para poner una cevichería.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Con Esperanza” (Women with Hope) meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. Portoviejo has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos” because of the large quantities of tamarind fruit that are produced this time of year.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Placida. She is 40 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a six-year-old son who is in school. Her husband is in the navy.

Placida is a homemaker who earns her own income by selling all types of clothing and products made by Oriflame (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She works three days a week, offering her products on credit and collecting payments on a weekly basis. The Oriflame products are shipped to her home and Placida buys clothes in Guayaquil as often as necessary. She has been in business for six years and has done very well. Placida has plans of opening a “cevicheria” (a restaurant that serves marinated seafood) in the central part of the city and hopes that it will become a reality soon.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and clothing. She has been with the Communal Bank for six years and enjoys being a member because the loans have been a great help in financing her business.

Her dream is to open a “cevicheria” in the central part of town.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Meilin

texts.en:
Meilin is 36 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Meilin has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. Meilin requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like soft drinks, groceries etc. to sell in her store.

Meilin has been in this business for four years. In the future, Meilin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like soft drinks, groceries etc. to sell in her store
